087/**
088 * Defines the initial configuration of a <c>RestServlet</c> or <c>@Rest</c> annotated object.
089 *
090 * <p>
091 * An extension of the {@link ServletConfig} object used during servlet initialization.
092 *
093 * <p>
094 * Methods are provided for overriding or augmenting the information provided by the <ja>@Rest</ja> annotation.
095 * In general, most information provided in the <ja>@Rest</ja> annotation can be specified programmatically
096 * through calls on this object.
097 *
098 * <p>
099 * To interact with this object, simply pass it in as a constructor argument or in an INIT hook.
100 * <p class='bjava'>
101 *    <jc>// Option #1 - Pass in through constructor.</jc>
102 *    <jk>public</jk> MyResource(RestContext.Builder <jv>builder</jv>) {
103 *          <jv>builder</jv>
104 *             .swaps(TemporalCalendarSwap.IsoLocalDateTime.<jk>class</jk>);
105 *    }
106 *
107 *    <jc>// Option #2 - Use an init hook.</jc>
108 *    <ja>@RestInit</ja>
109 *    <jk>public void</jk> init(RestContext.Builder <jv>builder</jv>) <jk>throws</jk> Exception {
110 *          <jv>builder</jv>
111 *             .swaps(TemporalCalendarSwap.IsoLocalDateTime.<jk>class</jk>);
112 *    }
113 * </p>
114 *
115 * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
116 *    <li class='note'>This class is thread safe and reusable.
117 * </ul>
118 *
119 * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
120 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/RestContext">RestContext</a>
121
122 * </ul>
123 */
124public class RestContext extends Context {
125   /**
126    * Builder class.
127    */
128   public static class Builder extends Context.Builder implements ServletConfig {
129
130      private static final AnnotationProvider AP = AnnotationProvider.INSTANCE;

180      private static final Set<String> DELAYED_INJECTION_NAMES = set(
181         "defaultRequestAttributes",
182         "defaultRequestHeaders",
183         "defaultResponseHeaders",
184         "destroyMethods",

194      //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
195      // The following fields are meant to be modifiable.
196      // They should not be declared final.
197      // Read-only snapshots of these will be made in RestServletContext.
198      //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
199
200      private static <T extends Annotation> MethodList getAnnotatedMethods(Supplier<?> resource, Class<T> annotation, Predicate<T> predicate) {
201         Map<String,Method> x = map();  // NOAI
202         var r = resource.get();
203         var ap = AP;
204
205         // @formatter:off
206         ClassInfo.ofProxy(r).getAllMethodsTopDown().stream()
207            .filter(y -> y.hasAnnotation(annotation))
208            .forEach(y -> rstream(ap.find(annotation, y)).map(AnnotationInfo::inner)
209            .filter(z -> predicate == null || predicate.test(z))
210            .forEach(z -> x.put(y.getSignature(), y.accessible().inner())));
211         // @formatter:on
212
213         var x2 = MethodList.of(x.values());
214         return x2;
215      }
216
217      private static boolean isRestBeanMethod(MethodInfo mi) {
218         var x = mi.getAnnotations(RestInject.class).findFirst().map(AnnotationInfo::inner).orElse(null);
219         return nn(x) && x.methodScope().length == 0;
220      }
221
222      private static boolean isRestBeanMethod(MethodInfo mi, String name) {
223         var x = mi.getAnnotations(RestInject.class).findFirst().map(AnnotationInfo::inner).orElse(null);
224         return nn(x) && x.methodScope().length == 0 && x.name().equals(name);
225      }

285
286      /**
287       * Constructor.
288       *
289       * @param resourceClass
290       *    The REST servlet/bean type that this context is defined against.
291       * @param parentContext The parent context if this is a child of another resource.
292       * @param servletConfig The servlet config if available.
293       */
294      protected Builder(Class<?> resourceClass, RestContext parentContext, ServletConfig servletConfig) {
295
296         this.resourceClass = resourceClass;
297         this.inner = servletConfig;
298         this.parentContext = parentContext;
299
300         // Pass-through default values.
301         if (nn(parentContext)) {
302            defaultClasses = parentContext.defaultClasses.copy();
303            defaultSettings = parentContext.defaultSettings.copy();
304            rootBeanStore = parentContext.rootBeanStore;
305         } else {
306            defaultClasses = DefaultClassList.create();
307            defaultSettings = DefaultSettingsMap.create();
308         }
309      }
310
311      /**
312       * Allowed header URL parameters.
313       *
314       * <p>
315       * When specified, allows headers such as <js>"Accept"</js> and <js>"Content-Type"</js> to be passed in as URL query
316       * parameters.
317       * <br>
318       * For example:
319       * <p class='burlenc'>
320       *  ?Accept=text/json&amp;Content-Type=text/json
321       * </p>
322       *
323       * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
324       *    <li class='note'>
325       *       Useful for debugging REST interface using only a browser so that you can quickly simulate header values
326       *       in the URL bar.
327       *    <li class='note'>
328       *       Header names are case-insensitive.
329       *    <li class='note'>
330       *       Use <js>"*"</js> to allow any headers to be specified as URL parameters.
331       *    <li class='note'>
332       *       Use <js>"NONE"</js> (case insensitive) to suppress inheriting a value from a parent class.
333       * </ul>
334       *
335       * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
336       *    <li class='ja'>{@link Rest#allowedHeaderParams}
337       * </ul>
338       *
339       * @param value
340       *    The new value for this setting.
341       *    <br>The default is the first value found:
342       *    <ul>
343       *       <li>System property <js>"RestContext.allowedHeaderParams"
344       *       <li>Environment variable <js>"RESTCONTEXT_ALLOWEDHEADERPARAMS"
345       *       <li><js>"Accept,Content-Type"</js>
346       *    </ul>
347       *    <br>Cannot be <jk>null</jk>.
348       * @return This object.
349       */
350      public Builder allowedHeaderParams(String value) {
351         allowedHeaderParams = assertArgNotNull("value", value);
352         return this;
353      }
354
355      /**
356       * Allowed method headers.
357       *
358       * <p>
359       * A comma-delimited list of HTTP method names that are allowed to be passed as values in an <c>X-Method</c> HTTP header
360       * to override the real HTTP method name.
361       *
362       * <p>
363       * Allows you to override the actual HTTP method with a simulated method.
364       * <br>For example, if an HTTP Client API doesn't support <c>PATCH</c> but does support <c>POST</c> (because
365       * <c>PATCH</c> is not part of the original HTTP spec), you can add a <c>X-Method: PATCH</c> header on a normal
366       * <c>HTTP POST /foo</c> request call which will make the HTTP call look like a <c>PATCH</c> request in any of the REST APIs.
367       *
368       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
369       * <p class='bjava'>
370       *    <jc>// Option #1 - Defined via annotation resolving to a config file setting with default value.</jc>
371       *    <ja>@Rest</ja>(allowedMethodHeaders=<js>"PATCH"</js>)
372       *    <jk>public class</jk> MyResource {
373       *
374       *       <jc>// Option #2 - Defined via builder passed in through resource constructor.</jc>
375       *       <jk>public</jk> MyResource(RestContext.Builder <jv>builder</jv>) <jk>throws</jk> Exception {
376       *
377       *          <jc>// Using method on builder.</jc>
378       *          <jv>builder</jv>.allowedMethodHeaders(<js>"PATCH"</js>);
379       *       }
380       *
381       *       <jc>// Option #3 - Defined via builder passed in through init method.</jc>
382       *       <ja>@RestInit</ja>
383       *       <jk>public void</jk> init(RestContext.Builder <jv>builder</jv>) <jk>throws</jk> Exception {
384       *          <jv>builder</jv>.allowedMethodHeaders(<js>"PATCH"</js>);
385       *       }
386       *    }
387       * </p>
388       *
389       * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
390       *    <li class='note'>
391       *       Method names are case-insensitive.
392       *    <li class='note'>
393       *       Use <js>"*"</js> to represent all methods.
394       *    <li class='note'>
395       *       Use <js>"NONE"</js> (case insensitive) to suppress inheriting a value from a parent class.
396       * </ul>
397       *
398       * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
399       *    <li class='ja'>{@link Rest#allowedMethodHeaders}
400       * </ul>
401       *
402       * @param value
403       *    The new value for this setting.
404       *    <br>The default is the first value found:
405       *    <ul>
406       *       <li>System property <js>"RestContext.allowedMethodHeaders"
407       *       <li>Environment variable <js>"RESTCONTEXT_ALLOWEDMETHODHEADERS"
408       *       <li><js>""</js>
409       *    </ul>
410       *    <br>Cannot be <jk>null</jk>.
411       * @return This object.
412       */
413      public Builder allowedMethodHeaders(String value) {
414         allowedMethodHeaders = assertArgNotNull("value", value);
415         return this;
416      }
417
418      /**
419       * Allowed method parameters.
420       *
421       * <p>
422       * When specified, the HTTP method can be overridden by passing in a <js>"method"</js> URL parameter on a regular
423       * GET request.
424       * <br>
425       * For example:
426       * <p class='burlenc'>
427       *  ?method=OPTIONS
428       * </p>
429       *
430       * <p>
431       *    Useful in cases where you want to simulate a non-GET request in a browser by simply adding a parameter.
432       *    <br>Also useful if you want to construct hyperlinks to non-GET REST endpoints such as links to <c>OPTIONS</c>
433       * pages.
434       *
435       * <p>
436       * Note that per the <a class="doclink" href="https://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec9.html">HTTP specification</a>, special care should
437       * be taken when allowing non-safe (<c>POST</c>, <c>PUT</c>, <c>DELETE</c>) methods to be invoked through GET requests.
438       *
439       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
440       * <p class='bjava'>
441       *    <jc>// Option #1 - Defined via annotation.</jc>
442       *    <ja>@Rest</ja>(allowedMethodParams=<js>"HEAD,OPTIONS,PUT"</js>)
443       *    <jk>public class</jk> MyResource {
444       *
445       *       <jc>// Option #2 - Defined via builder passed in through resource constructor.</jc>
446       *       <jk>public</jk> MyResource(RestContext.Builder <jv>builder</jv>) <jk>throws</jk> Exception {
447       *
448       *          <jc>// Using method on builder.</jc>
449       *          <jv>builder</jv>.allowedMethodParams(<js>"HEAD,OPTIONS,PUT"</js>);
450       *       }
451       *
452       *       <jc>// Option #3 - Defined via builder passed in through init method.</jc>
453       *       <ja>@RestInit</ja>
454       *       <jk>public void</jk> init(RestContext.Builder builder) <jk>throws</jk> Exception {
455       *          <jv>builder</jv>.allowedMethodParams(<js>"HEAD,OPTIONS,PUT"</js>);
456       *       }
457       *    }
458       * </p>
459       *
460       * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
461       *    <li class='note'>
462       *       Format is a comma-delimited list of HTTP method names that can be passed in as a method parameter.
463       *    <li class='note'>
464       *       <js>'method'</js> parameter name is case-insensitive.
465       *    <li class='note'>
466       *       Use <js>"*"</js> to represent all methods.
467       *    <li class='note'>
468       *       Use <js>"NONE"</js> (case insensitive) to suppress inheriting a value from a parent class.
469       * </ul>
470       *
471       * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
472       *    <li class='ja'>{@link Rest#allowedMethodParams}
473       * </ul>
474       *
475       * @param value
476       *    The new value for this setting.
477       *    <br>The default is the first value found:
478       *    <ul>
479       *       <li>System property <js>"RestContext.allowedMethodParams"
480       *       <li>Environment variable <js>"RESTCONTEXT_ALLOWEDMETHODPARAMS"
481       *       <li><js>"HEAD,OPTIONS"</js>
482       *    </ul>
483       *    <br>Cannot be <jk>null</jk>.
484       * @return This object.
485       */
486      public Builder allowedMethodParams(String value) {
487         allowedMethodParams = assertArgNotNull("value", value);
488         return this;
489      }
490
491      @Override /* Overridden from Builder */
492      public Builder annotations(Annotation...values) {
493         super.annotations(values);
494         return this;
495      }
496
497      @Override /* Overridden from Builder */
498      public Builder apply(AnnotationWorkList work) {
499         super.apply(work);
500         return this;
501      }
502
503      @Override /* Overridden from Builder */
504      public Builder applyAnnotations(Class<?>...from) {
505         super.applyAnnotations(from);
506         return this;
507      }
508
509      @Override /* Overridden from Builder */
510      public Builder applyAnnotations(Object...from) {
511         super.applyAnnotations(from);
512         return this;
513      }
514
515      /**
516       * Returns the bean context sub-builder.
517       *
518       * <p>
519       * The bean context is used to retrieve metadata on Java beans.
520       *
521       * <p>
522       * The default bean context can overridden via any of the following:
523       * <ul class='spaced-list'>
524       *    <li>Injected via bean store.
525       * </ul>
526       *
527       * @return The bean context sub-builder.
528       */
529      public BeanContext.Builder beanContext() {
530         if (beanContext == null)
531            beanContext = createBeanContext(beanStore(), resource());
532         return beanContext;
533      }
534
535      /**
536       * Returns the bean store in this builder.
537       *
538       * <p>
539       * The bean store is a simple storage database for beans keyed by type and name.
540       *
541       * <p>
542       * The bean store is created with the parent root bean store as the parent, allowing any beans in the root bean store to be available
543       * in this builder.  The root bean store typically pulls from an injection framework such as Spring to allow injected beans to be used.
544       *
545       * <p>
546       * The default bean store can be overridden via any of the following:
547       * <ul class='spaced-list'>
548       *    <li>Class annotation:  {@link Rest#beanStore() @Rest(beanStore)}
549       *    <li>{@link RestInject @RestInject}-annotated methods:
550       *       <p class='bjava'>
551       *    <ja>@RestInject</ja> <jk>public</jk> [<jk>static</jk>] BeanStore myMethod(<i>&lt;args&gt;</i>) {...}
552       *       </p>
553       *       Args can be any injected bean including {@link org.apache.juneau.cp.BeanStore.Builder}, the default builder.
554       * </ul>
555       *
556       * @return The bean store in this builder.
557       */
558      public BeanStore beanStore() {
559         return beanStore;
560      }
561
562      /**
563       * Adds a bean to the bean store of this class.
564       *
565       * <p>
566       * Equivalent to calling:
567       * <p class='bjava'>
568       *    <jv>builder</jv>.beanStore().add(<jv>beanType</jv>, <jv>bean</jv>);
569       * </p>
570       *
571       * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
572       *    <li class='jm'>{@link #beanStore()}
573       * </ul>
574       *
575       * @param <T> The class to associate this bean with.
576       * @param beanType The class to associate this bean with.
577       * @param bean The bean.
578       *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk> (a null bean will be stored in the bean store).
579       * @return This object.
580       */
581      public <T> Builder beanStore(Class<T> beanType, T bean) {
582         beanStore().addBean(beanType, bean);
583         return this;
584      }
585
586      /**
587       * Adds a bean to the bean store of this class.
588       *
589       * <p>
590       * Equivalent to calling:
591       * <p class='bjava'>
592       *    <jv>builder</jv>.beanStore().add(<jv>beanType</jv>, <jv>bean</jv>, <jv>name</jv>);
593       * </p>
594       *
595       * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
596       *    <li class='jm'>{@link #beanStore()}
597       * </ul>
598       *
599       * @param <T> The class to associate this bean with.
600       * @param beanType The class to associate this bean with.
601       * @param bean The bean.
602       *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk> (a null bean will be stored in the bean store).
603       * @param name The bean name if this is a named bean.
604       *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk> (bean will be stored as an unnamed bean).
605       * @return This object.
606       */
607      public <T> Builder beanStore(Class<T> beanType, T bean, String name) {
608         beanStore().addBean(beanType, bean, name);
609         return this;
610      }
611
612      @Override /* Overridden from BeanContext.Builder */
613      public RestContext build() {
614         try {
615            return beanStore().createBean(RestContext.class).type(getType().orElse(RestContext.class)).builder(RestContext.Builder.class, this).run();
616         } catch (Exception e) {
617            e.printStackTrace();  // NOSONAR
618            throw new InternalServerError(e, "Could not instantiate RestContext.");
619         }
620      }
621
622      @Override /* Overridden from Builder */
623      public Builder cache(Cache<HashKey,? extends org.apache.juneau.Context> value) {
624         super.cache(value);
625         return this;
626      }
627
628      /**
629       * Returns the call logger bean creator.
630       *
631       * <p>
632       * Specifies the logger to use for logging of HTTP requests and responses.
633       *
634       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
635       * <p class='bjava'>
636       *    <jc>// Our customized logger.</jc>
637       *    <jk>public class</jk> MyLogger <jk>extends</jk> BasicCallLogger {
638       *
639       *       <jk>public</jk> MyLogger(BeanStore <jv>beanStore</jv>) {
640       *       <jk>super</jk>(<jv>beanStore</jv>);
641       *    }
642       *
643       *       <ja>@Override</ja>
644       *          <jk>protected void</jk> log(Level <jv>level</jv>, String <jv>msg</jv>, Throwable <jv>e</jv>) {
645       *          <jc>// Handle logging ourselves.</jc>
646       *       }
647       *    }
648       *
649       *    <jc>// Option #1 - Registered via annotation resolving to a config file setting with default value.</jc>
650       *    <ja>@Rest</ja>(callLogger=MyLogger.<jk>class</jk>)
651       *    <jk>public class</jk> MyResource {
652       *
653       *       <jc>// Option #2 - Registered via builder passed in through init method.</jc>
654       *       <ja>@RestInit</ja>
655       *       <jk>public void</jk> init(RestContext.Builder <jv>builder</jv>) <jk>throws</jk> Exception {
656       *          <jv>builder</jv>.callLogger(MyLogger.<jk>class</jk>);
657       *       }
658       *    }
659       * </p>
660       *
661       * <p>
662       * The default call logger can overridden via any of the following:
663       * <ul class='spaced-list'>
664       *    <li>Injected via bean store.
665       *    <li>Class annotation:  {@link Rest#callLogger() @Rest(callLogger)}
666       *    <li>{@link RestInject @RestInject}-annotated method:
667       *       <p class='bjava'>
668       *    <ja>@RestInject</ja> <jk>public</jk> [<jk>static</jk>] CallLogger myMethod(<i>&lt;args&gt;</i>) {...}
669       *       </p>
670       *       Args can be any injected bean.
671       * </ul>
672       *
673       * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
674       *    <li class='note'>
675       *       The default call logger if not specified is {@link BasicCallLogger}.
676       *    <li class='note'>
677       *       The resource class itself will be used if it implements the {@link CallLogger} interface and not
678       *       explicitly overridden via this annotation.
679       *    <li class='note'>
680       *       When defined as a class, the implementation must have one of the following constructor:
681       *       <ul>
682       *          <li><code><jk>public</jk> T(BeanStore)</code>
683       *       </ul>
684       *    <li class='note'>
685       *       Inner classes of the REST resource class are allowed.
686       * </ul>
687       *
688       * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
689       *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/RestServerLoggingAndDebugging">Logging / Debugging</a>
690       * </ul>
691       *
692       * @return The call logger sub-builder.
693       * @throws RuntimeException If {@link #init(Supplier)} has not been called.
694       */
695      public BeanCreator<CallLogger> callLogger() {
696         if (callLogger == null)
697            callLogger = createCallLogger(beanStore, resource);
698         return callLogger;
699      }
700
701      /**
702       * Specifies the call logger for this class.
703       *
704       * <p>
705       * Equivalent to calling:
706       * <p class='bjava'>
707       *    <jv>builder</jv>.callLogger().impl(<jv>value</jv>);
708       * </p>
709       *
710       * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
711       *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/RestServerLoggingAndDebugging">Logging / Debugging</a>
712       *    <li class='jm'>{@link #callLogger()}
713       * </ul>
714       *
715       * @param value The new value.
716       *    <br>Cannot be <jk>null</jk>.
717       * @return This object.
718       */
719      public Builder callLogger(CallLogger value) {
720         callLogger().impl(assertArgNotNull("value", value));
721         return this;
722      }
723
724      /**
725       * Specifies the call logger for this class.
726       *
727       * <p>
728       * Equivalent to calling:
729       * <p class='bjava'>
730       *    <jv>builder</jv>.callLogger().type(<jv>value</jv>);
731       * </p>
732       *
733       * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
734       *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/RestServerLoggingAndDebugging">Logging / Debugging</a>
735       *    <li class='jm'>{@link #callLogger()}
736       * </ul>
737       *
738       * @param value The new value.
739       *    <br>Cannot be <jk>null</jk>.
740       * @return This object.
741       */
742      public Builder callLogger(Class<? extends CallLogger> value) {
743         callLogger().type(assertArgNotNull("value", value));
744         return this;
745      }
746
747      /**
748       * Add a child REST resource.
749       *
750       * <p>
751       * Shortcut for adding a single child to this resource.
752       *
753       * <p>
754       * This can be used for resources that don't have a {@link Rest#path() @Rest(path)} annotation.
755       *
756       * @param path The child path relative to the parent resource URI.
757       *    <br>Cannot be <jk>null</jk>.
758       * @param child The child to add to this resource.
759       * @return This object.
760       */
761      public Builder child(String path, Object child) {
762         children.add(new RestChild(assertArgNotNull("path", path), child));
763         return this;
764      }
765
766      /**
767       * Child REST resources.
768       *
769       * <p>
770       * Defines children of this resource.
771       *
772       * <p>
773       * A REST child resource is simply another servlet or object that is initialized as part of the ascendant resource and has a
774       * servlet path directly under the ascendant resource object path.
775       * <br>The main advantage to defining servlets as REST children is that you do not need to define them in the
776       * <c>web.xml</c> file of the web application.
777       * <br>This can cut down on the number of entries that show up in the <c>web.xml</c> file if you are defining
778       * large numbers of servlets.
779       *
780       * <p>
781       * Child resources must specify a value for {@link Rest#path() @Rest(path)} that identifies the subpath of the child resource
782       * relative to the ascendant path UNLESS you use the {@link RestContext.Builder#child(String, Object)} method to register it.
783       *
784       * <p>
785       * Child resources can be nested arbitrarily deep using this technique (i.e. children can also have children).
786       *
787       * <dl>
788       *    <dt>Servlet initialization:</dt>
789       *    <dd>
790       *       <p>
791       *          A child resource will be initialized immediately after the ascendant servlet/resource is initialized.
792       *          <br>The child resource receives the same servlet config as the ascendant servlet/resource.
793       *          <br>This allows configuration information such as servlet initialization parameters to filter to child
794       *          resources.
795       *       </p>
796       *    </dd>
797       *    <dt>Runtime behavior:</dt>
798       *    <dd>
799       *       <p>
800       *          As a rule, methods defined on the <c>HttpServletRequest</c> object will behave as if the child
801       *          servlet were deployed as a top-level resource under the child's servlet path.
802       *          <br>For example, the <c>getServletPath()</c> and <c>getPathInfo()</c> methods on the
803       *          <c>HttpServletRequest</c> object will behave as if the child resource were deployed using the
804       *          child's servlet path.
805       *          <br>Therefore, the runtime behavior should be equivalent to deploying the child servlet in the
806       *          <c>web.xml</c> file of the web application.
807       *       </p>
808       *    </dd>
809       * </dl>
810       *
811       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
812       * <p class='bjava'>
813       *    <jc>// Our child resource.</jc>
814       *    <ja>@Rest</ja>(path=<js>"/child"</js>)
815       *    <jk>public class</jk> MyChildResource {...}
816       *
817       *    <jc>// Option #1 - Registered via annotation.</jc>
818       *    <ja>@Rest</ja>(children={MyChildResource.<jk>class</jk>})
819       *    <jk>public class</jk> MyResource {
820       *
821       *       <jc>// Option #2 - Registered via builder passed in through resource constructor.</jc>
822       *       <jk>public</jk> MyResource(RestContext.Builder <jv>builder</jv>) <jk>throws</jk> Exception {
823       *
824       *          <jc>// Using method on builder.</jc>
825       *          <jv>builder</jv>.children(MyChildResource.<jk>class</jk>);
826       *
827       *          <jc>// Use a pre-instantiated object instead.</jc>
828       *          <jv>builder</jv>.child(<js>"/child"</js>, <jk>new</jk> MyChildResource());
829       *       }
830       *
831       *       <jc>// Option #3 - Registered via builder passed in through init method.</jc>
832       *       <ja>@RestInit</ja>
833       *       <jk>public void</jk> init(RestContext.Builder <jv>builder</jv>) <jk>throws</jk> Exception {
834       *          <jv>builder</jv>.children(MyChildResource.<jk>class</jk>);
835       *       }
836       *    }
837       * </p>
838       *
839       * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
840       *    <li class='note'>
841       *       When defined as classes, instances are resolved using the registered bean store which
842       *       by default is {@link BeanStore} which requires the class have one of the following
843       *       constructors:
844       *       <ul>
845       *          <li><code><jk>public</jk> T(RestContext.Builder)</code>
846       *          <li><code><jk>public</jk> T()</code>
847       *       </ul>
848       * </ul>
849       *
850       * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
851       *    <li class='ja'>{@link Rest#children()}
852       * </ul>
853       *
854       * @param values The child resources to add.
855       *    <br>Cannot contain <jk>null</jk> values.
856       *    <br>Objects can be any of the specified types:
857       *    <ul>
858       *       <li>A class that has a constructor described above.
859       *       <li>An instantiated resource object (such as a servlet object instantiated by a servlet container).
860       *       <li>An instance of {@link RestChild} containing an instantiated resource object and a subpath.
861       *    </ul>
862       * @return This object.
863       */
864      public Builder children(Object...values) {
865         assertArgNoNulls("values", values);
866         addAll(children, values);
867         return this;
868      }
869
870      /**
871       * Client version header.
872       *
873       * <p>
874       * Specifies the name of the header used to denote the client version on HTTP requests.
875       *
876       * <p>
877       * The client version is used to support backwards compatibility for breaking REST interface changes.
878       * <br>Used in conjunction with {@link RestOp#clientVersion() @RestOp(clientVersion)} annotation.
879       *
880       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
881       * <p class='bjava'>
882       *    <jc>// Option #1 - Defined via annotation resolving to a config file setting with default value.</jc>
883       *    <ja>@Rest</ja>(clientVersionHeader=<js>"$C{REST/clientVersionHeader,Client-Version}"</js>)
884       *    <jk>public class</jk> MyResource {
885       *
886       *       <jc>// Option #2 - Defined via builder passed in through resource constructor.</jc>
887       *       <jk>public</jk> MyResource(RestContext.Builder <jv>builder</jv>) <jk>throws</jk> Exception {
888       *
889       *          <jc>// Using method on builder.</jc>
890       *          <jv>builder</jv>.clientVersionHeader(<js>"Client-Version"</js>);
891       *       }
892       *
893       *       <jc>// Option #3 - Defined via builder passed in through init method.</jc>
894       *       <ja>@RestInit</ja>
895       *       <jk>public void</jk> init(RestContext.Builder <jv>builder</jv>) <jk>throws</jk> Exception {
896       *          <jv>builder</jv>.clientVersionHeader(<js>"Client-Version"</js>);
897       *       }
898       *    }
899       * </p>
900       *
901       * <p class='bjava'>
902       *    <jc>// Call this method if Client-Version is at least 2.0.
903       *    // Note that this also matches 2.0.1.</jc>
904       *    <ja>@RestGet</ja>(path=<js>"/foobar"</js>, clientVersion=<js>"2.0"</js>)
905       *    <jk>public</jk> Object method1() {
906       *       ...
907       *    }
908       *
909       *    <jc>// Call this method if Client-Version is at least 1.1, but less than 2.0.</jc>
910       *    <ja>@RestGet</ja>(path=<js>"/foobar"</js>, clientVersion=<js>"[1.1,2.0)"</js>)
911       *    <jk>public</jk> Object method2() {
912       *       ...
913       *    }
914       *
915       *    <jc>// Call this method if Client-Version is less than 1.1.</jc>
916       *    <ja>@RestGet</ja>(path=<js>"/foobar"</js>, clientVersion=<js>"[0,1.1)"</js>)
917       *    <jk>public</jk> Object method3() {
918       *       ...
919       *    }
920       * </p>
921       *
922       * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
923       *    <li class='ja'>{@link Rest#clientVersionHeader}
924       * </ul>
925       *
926       * @param value
927       *    The new value for this setting.
928       *    <br>The default is the first value found:
929       *    <ul>
930       *       <li>System property <js>"RestContext.clientVersionHeader"
931       *       <li>Environment variable <js>"RESTCONTEXT_CLIENTVERSIONHEADER"
932       *       <li><js>"Client-Version"</js>
933       *    </ul>
934       *    <br>Cannot be <jk>null</jk>.
935       * @return This object.
936       */
937      public Builder clientVersionHeader(String value) {
938         clientVersionHeader = assertArgNotNull("value", value);
939         return this;
940      }
941
942      /**
943       * Returns the external configuration file for this resource.
944       *
945       * <p>
946       * The config file contains arbitrary configuration information that can be accessed by this class, usually
947       * via <c>$C</c> variables.
948       *
949       * <p>
950       * The default config can be overridden via any of the following:
951       * <ul class='spaced-list'>
952       *    <li>Injected via bean store.
953       *    <li>Class annotation:  {@link Rest#config() @Rest(config)}
954       *    <li>{@link RestInject @RestInject}-annotated method:
955       *       <p class='bjava'>
956       *    <ja>@RestInject</ja> <jk>public</jk> [<jk>static</jk>] Config myMethod(<i>&lt;args&gt;</i>) {...}
957       *       </p>
958       *       Args can be any injected bean.
959       * </ul>
960       *
961       * <p>
962       * If a config file is not set up, then an empty config file will be returned that is not backed by any file.
963       *
964       * <p>
965       * This bean can be accessed directly via {@link RestContext#getConfig()} or passed in as a parameter
966       * on a {@link RestOp}-annotated method.
967       *
968       * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
969       *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/ConfigurationFiles">Configuration Files</a>
970       * </ul>
971       *
972       * @return The external configuration file for this resource.
973       */
974      public Config config() {
975         return config;
976      }
977
978      /**
979       * Overwrites the default config file with a custom config file.
980       *
981       * <p>
982       * By default, the config file is determined using the {@link Rest#config() @Rest(config)}
983       * annotation.
984       * This method allows you to programmatically override it with your own custom config file.
985       *
986       * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
987       *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/ConfigurationFiles">Configuration Files</a>
988       *    <li class='jm'>{@link #config()}
989       * </ul>
990       *
991       * @param value The new config file.
992       *    <br>Cannot be <jk>null</jk>.
993       * @return This object.
994       */
995      public Builder config(Config value) {
996         config = assertArgNotNull("value", value);
997         return this;
998      }

1000      /**
1001       * Returns the media types consumed by this resource if it's manually specified.
1002       *
1003       * @return The media types.
1004       */
1005      public Optional<List<MediaType>> consumes() {
1006         return opt(consumes);
1007      }
1008
1009      /**
1010       * Supported content media types.
1011       *
1012       * <p>
1013       * Overrides the media types inferred from the parsers that identify what media types can be consumed by the resource.
1014       * <br>An example where this might be useful if you have parsers registered that handle media types that you
1015       * don't want exposed in the Swagger documentation.
1016       *
1017       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
1018       * <p class='bjava'>
1019       *    <jc>// Option #1 - Defined via annotation resolving to a config file setting with default value.</jc>
1020       *    <ja>@Rest</ja>(consumes={<js>"$C{REST/supportedConsumes,application/json}"</js>})
1021       *    <jk>public class</jk> MyResource {
1022       *
1023       *       <jc>// Option #2 - Defined via builder passed in through resource constructor.</jc>
1024       *       <jk>public</jk> MyResource(RestContext.Builder <jv>builder</jv>) <jk>throws</jk> Exception {
1025       *
1026       *          <jc>// Using method on builder.</jc>
1027       *          <jv>builder</jv>.consumes(<jk>false</jk>, <js>"application/json"</js>)
1028       *       }
1029       *
1030       *       <jc>// Option #3 - Defined via builder passed in through init method.</jc>
1031       *       <ja>@RestInit</ja>
1032       *       <jk>public void</jk> init(RestContext.Builder <jv>builder</jv>) <jk>throws</jk> Exception {
1033       *          <jv>builder</jv>.consumes(<jk>false</jk>, <js>"application/json"</js>);
1034       *       }
1035       *    }
1036       * </p>
1037       *
1038       * <p>
1039       * This affects the returned values from the following:
1040       * <ul class='javatree'>
1041       *    <li class='jm'>{@link RestContext#getConsumes() RestContext.getConsumes()}
1042       * </ul>
1043       *
1044       * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
1045       *    <li class='ja'>{@link Rest#consumes}
1046       *    <li class='ja'>{@link RestOp#consumes}
1047       *    <li class='ja'>{@link RestPut#consumes}
1048       *    <li class='ja'>{@link RestPost#consumes}
1049       * </ul>
1050       *
1051       * @param values The values to add to this setting.
1052       *    <br>Cannot contain <jk>null</jk> values.
1053       * @return This object.
1054       */
1055      public Builder consumes(MediaType...values) {
1056         assertArgNoNulls("values", values);
1057         consumes = addAll(consumes, values);
1058         return this;
1059      }

1061      @Override /* Overridden from Context.Builder */
1062      public Builder copy() {
1063         throw new NoSuchMethodError("Not implemented.");
1064      }

1067      public Builder debug() {
1068         super.debug();
1069         return this;
1070      }

1073      public Builder debug(boolean value) {
1074         super.debug(value);
1075         return this;
1076      }

1078      /**

1080       *
1081       * <p>
1082       * The default debug value is the enablement value if not otherwise overridden at the class or method level.
1083       *
1084       * @param value The debug default value.
1085       *    <br>Cannot be <jk>null</jk>.
1086       * @return This object.
1087       */
1088      public Builder debugDefault(Enablement value) {
1089         defaultSettings().set("RestContext.debugDefault", assertArgNotNull("value", value));
1090         return this;
1091      }

1093      /**
1094       * Returns the debug enablement bean creator.
1095       *
1096       * <p>
1097       * Enables the following:
1098       * <ul class='spaced-list'>
1099       *    <li>
1100       *       HTTP request/response bodies are cached in memory for logging purposes.
1101       *    <li>
1102       *       Request/response messages are automatically logged always or per request.
1103       * </ul>
1104       *
1105       * @return The debug enablement sub-builder.
1106       */
1107      public BeanCreator<DebugEnablement> debugEnablement() {
1108         if (debugEnablement == null)
1109            debugEnablement = createDebugEnablement(beanStore, resource);
1110         return debugEnablement;
1111      }

1118       * @return This object.

1120      public Builder debugEnablement(Class<? extends DebugEnablement> value) {
1121         debugEnablement().type(assertArgNotNull("value", value));
1122         return this;

1126       * Specifies the debug enablement class to use for this REST context.

1132      public Builder debugEnablement(DebugEnablement value) {
1133         debugEnablement().impl(assertArgNotNull("value", value));
1134         return this;
1135      }

1137      /**
1138       * Specifies a default <c>Accept</c> header value if not specified on a request.
1139       *
1140       * @param value
1141       *    The default value of the <c>Accept</c> header.
1142       *    <br>Ignored if <jk>null</jk> or empty.
1143       * @return This object.
1144       */
1145      public Builder defaultAccept(String value) {
1146         if (ne(value))
1147            defaultRequestHeaders(accept(value));
1148         return this;
1149      }
1150
1151      /**
1152       * Default character encoding.
1153       *
1154       * <p>
1155       * The default character encoding for the request and response if not specified on the request.
1156       *
1157       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
1158       * <p class='bjava'>
1159       *    <jc>// Option #1 - Defined via annotation resolving to a config file setting with default value.</jc>
1160       *    <ja>@Rest</ja>(defaultCharset=<js>"$C{REST/defaultCharset,US-ASCII}"</js>)
1161       *    <jk>public class</jk> MyResource {
1162       *
1163       *       <jc>// Option #2 - Defined via builder passed in through resource constructor.</jc>
1164       *       <jk>public</jk> MyResource(RestContext.Builder <jv>builder</jv>) <jk>throws</jk> Exception {
1165       *
1166       *          <jc>// Using method on builder.</jc>
1167       *          <jv>builder</jv>.defaultCharset(<js>"US-ASCII"</js>);
1168       *       }
1169       *
1170       *       <jc>// Option #3 - Defined via builder passed in through init method.</jc>
1171       *       <ja>@RestInit</ja>
1172       *       <jk>public void</jk> init(RestContext.Builder <jv>builder</jv>) <jk>throws</jk> Exception {
1173       *          <jv>builder</jv>.defaultCharset(<js>"US-ASCII"</js>);
1174       *       }
1175       *
1176       *       <jc>// Override at the method level.</jc>
1177       *       <ja>@RestGet</ja>(defaultCharset=<js>"UTF-16"</js>)
1178       *       <jk>public</jk> Object myMethod() {...}
1179       *    }
1180       * </p>
1181       *
1182       * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
1183       *    <li class='ja'>{@link Rest#defaultCharset}
1184       *    <li class='ja'>{@link RestOp#defaultCharset}
1185       * </ul>
1186       *
1187       * @param value
1188       *    The new value for this setting.
1189       *    <br>The default is the first value found:
1190       *    <ul>
1191       *       <li>System property <js>"RestContext.defaultCharset"
1192       *       <li>Environment variable <js>"RESTCONTEXT_defaultCharset"
1193       *       <li><js>"utf-8"</js>
1194       *    </ul>
1195       *    <br>Cannot be <jk>null</jk>.
1196       * @return This object.
1197       */
1198      public Builder defaultCharset(Charset value) {
1199         defaultCharset = assertArgNotNull("value", value);
1200         return this;
1201      }
1202
1203      /**
1204       * Returns the default implementation class list.
1205       *
1206       * <p>
1207       * This defines the implementation classes for a variety of bean types.
1208       *
1209       * <p>
1210       * Default classes are inherited from the parent REST object.
1211       * Typically used on the top-level {@link RestContext.Builder} to affect class types for that REST object and all children.
1212       *
1213       * <p>
1214       * Modifying the default class list on this builder does not affect the default class list on the parent builder, but changes made
1215       * here are inherited by child builders.
1216       *
1217       * @return The default implementation class list.
1218       */
1219      public DefaultClassList defaultClasses() {
1220         return defaultClasses;
1221      }
1222
1223      /**
1224       * Adds to the default implementation class list.
1225       *
1226       * <p>
1227       * A shortcut for the following code:
1228       *
1229       * <p class='bjava'>
1230       *    <jv>builder</jv>.defaultClasses().add(<jv>values</jv>);
1231       * </p>
1232       *
1233       * @param values The values to add to the list of default classes.
1234       *    <br>Cannot contain <jk>null</jk> values.
1235       * @return This object.
1236       * @see #defaultClasses()
1237       */
1238      public Builder defaultClasses(Class<?>...values) {
1239         assertArgNoNulls("values", values);
1240         defaultClasses().add(values);
1241         return this;
1242      }
1243
1244      /**
1245       * Specifies a default <c>Content-Type</c> header value if not specified on a request.
1246       *
1247       * @param value
1248       *    The default value of the <c>Content-Type</c> header.
1249       *    <br>Ignored if <jk>null</jk> or empty.
1250       * @return This object.
1251       */
1252      public Builder defaultContentType(String value) {
1253         if (ne(value))
1254            defaultRequestHeaders(contentType(value));
1255         return this;
1256      }
1257
1258      /**
1259       * Returns the default request attributes sub-builder.
1260       *
1261       * @return The default request attributes sub-builder.
1262       */
1263      public NamedAttributeMap defaultRequestAttributes() {
1264         if (defaultRequestAttributes == null)
1265            defaultRequestAttributes = createDefaultRequestAttributes(beanStore(), resource());
1266         return defaultRequestAttributes;
1267      }
1268
1269      /**
1270       * Default request attributes.
1271       *
1272       * <p>
1273       * Specifies default values for request attributes if they're not already set on the request.
1274       *
1275       * Affects values returned by the following methods:
1276       * <ul>
1277       *    <li class='jm'>{@link RestRequest#getAttribute(String)}.
1278       *    <li class='jm'>{@link RestRequest#getAttributes()}.
1279       * </ul>
1280       *
1281       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
1282       * <p class='bjava'>
1283       *    <jc>// Option #1 - Defined via annotation resolving to a config file setting with default value.</jc>
1284       *    <ja>@Rest</ja>(defaultRequestAttributes={<js>"Foo=bar"</js>, <js>"Baz: $C{REST/myAttributeValue}"</js>})
1285       *    <jk>public class</jk> MyResource {
1286       *
1287       *       <jc>// Option #2 - Defined via builder passed in through resource constructor.</jc>
1288       *       <jk>public</jk> MyResource(RestContext.Builder <jv>builder</jv>) <jk>throws</jk> Exception {
1289       *
1290       *          <jc>// Using method on builder.</jc>
1291       *          <jv>builder</jv>
1292       *             .defaultRequestAttributes(
1293       *                BasicNamedAttribute.<jsm>of</jsm>(<js>"Foo"</js>, <js>"bar"</js>),
1294       *                BasicNamedAttribute.<jsm>of</jsm>(<js>"Baz"</js>, <jk>true</jk>)
1295       *             );
1296       *       }
1297       *
1298       *       <jc>// Option #3 - Defined via builder passed in through init method.</jc>
1299       *       <ja>@RestInit</ja>
1300       *       <jk>public void</jk> init(RestContext.Builder <jv>builder</jv>) <jk>throws</jk> Exception {
1301       *          <jv>builder</jv>.defaultRequestAttribute(<js>"Foo"</js>, <js>"bar"</js>);
1302       *       }
1303       *
1304       *       <jc>// Override at the method level.</jc>
1305       *       <ja>@RestGet</ja>(defaultRequestAttributes={<js>"Foo: bar"</js>})
1306       *       <jk>public</jk> Object myMethod() {...}
1307       *    }
1308       * </p>
1309       *
1310       * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
1311       *    <li class='note'>Use {@link BasicNamedAttribute#of(String, Supplier)} to provide a dynamically changeable attribute value.
1312       * </ul>
1313       *
1314       * @param values The attributes.
1315       *    <br>Cannot contain <jk>null</jk> values.
1316       * @return This object.
1317       */
1318      public Builder defaultRequestAttributes(NamedAttribute...values) {
1319         assertArgNoNulls("values", values);
1320         defaultRequestAttributes().add(values);
1321         return this;
1322      }
1323
1324      /**
1325       * Returns the default request headers.
1326       *
1327       * @return The default request headers.
1328       */
1329      public HeaderList defaultRequestHeaders() {
1330         if (defaultRequestHeaders == null)
1331            defaultRequestHeaders = createDefaultRequestHeaders(beanStore(), resource());
1332         return defaultRequestHeaders;
1333      }
1334
1335      /**
1336       * Default request headers.
1337       *
1338       * <p>
1339       * Specifies default values for request headers if they're not passed in through the request.
1340       *
1341       * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
1342       *    <li class='note'>
1343       *       Affects values returned by {@link RestRequest#getHeader(String)} when the header is not present on the request.
1344       *    <li class='note'>
1345       *       The most useful reason for this annotation is to provide a default <c>Accept</c> header when one is not
1346       *       specified so that a particular default {@link Serializer} is picked.
1347       * </ul>
1348       *
1349       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
1350       * <p class='bjava'>
1351       *    <jc>// Option #1 - Defined via annotation resolving to a config file setting with default value.</jc>
1352       *    <ja>@Rest</ja>(defaultRequestHeaders={<js>"Accept: application/json"</js>, <js>"My-Header=$C{REST/myHeaderValue}"</js>})
1353       *    <jk>public class</jk> MyResource {
1354       *
1355       *       <jc>// Option #2 - Defined via builder passed in through resource constructor.</jc>
1356       *       <jk>public</jk> MyResource(RestContext.Builder <jv>builder</jv>) <jk>throws</jk> Exception {
1357       *
1358       *          <jc>// Using method on builder.</jc>
1359       *          <jv>builder</jv>
1360       *             .defaultRequestHeaders(
1361       *                Accept.<jsm>of</jsm>(<js>"application/json"</js>),
1362       *                BasicHeader.<jsm>of</jsm>(<js>"My-Header"</js>, <js>"foo"</js>)
1363       *             );
1364       *       }
1365       *
1366       *       <jc>// Option #3 - Defined via builder passed in through init method.</jc>
1367       *       <ja>@RestInit</ja>
1368       *       <jk>public void</jk> init(RestContext.Builder <jv>builder</jv>) <jk>throws</jk> Exception {
1369       *          <jv>builder</jv>.defaultRequestHeaders(Accept.<jsm>of</jsm>(<js>"application/json"</js>));
1370       *       }
1371       *
1372       *       <jc>// Override at the method level.</jc>
1373       *       <ja>@RestGet</ja>(defaultRequestHeaders={<js>"Accept: text/xml"</js>})
1374       *       <jk>public</jk> Object myMethod() {...}
1375       *    }
1376       * </p>
1377       *
1378       * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
1379       *    <li class='ja'>{@link Rest#defaultRequestHeaders}
1380       *    <li class='ja'>{@link RestOp#defaultRequestHeaders}
1381       *    <li class='ja'>{@link RestGet#defaultRequestHeaders}
1382       *    <li class='ja'>{@link RestPut#defaultRequestHeaders}
1383       *    <li class='ja'>{@link RestPost#defaultRequestHeaders}
1384       *    <li class='ja'>{@link RestDelete#defaultRequestHeaders}
1385       * </ul>
1386       *
1387       * @param values The headers to add.
1388       *    <br>Cannot contain <jk>null</jk> values.
1389       * @return This object.
1390       */
1391      public Builder defaultRequestHeaders(Header...values) {
1392         assertArgNoNulls("values", values);
1393         defaultRequestHeaders().setDefault(values);
1394         return this;
1395      }
1396
1397      /**
1398       * Returns the default response headers.
1399       *
1400       * @return The default response headers.
1401       */
1402      public HeaderList defaultResponseHeaders() {
1403         if (defaultResponseHeaders == null)
1404            defaultResponseHeaders = createDefaultResponseHeaders(beanStore(), resource());
1405         return defaultResponseHeaders;
1406      }
1407
1408      /**
1409       * Default response headers.
1410       *
1411       * <p>
1412       * Specifies default values for response headers if they're not set after the Java REST method is called.
1413       *
1414       * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
1415       *    <li class='note'>
1416       *       This is equivalent to calling {@link RestResponse#setHeader(String, String)} programmatically in each of
1417       *       the Java methods.
1418       *    <li class='note'>
1419       *       The header value will not be set if the header value has already been specified (hence the 'default' in the name).
1420       * </ul>
1421       *
1422       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
1423       * <p class='bjava'>
1424       *    <jc>// Option #1 - Defined via annotation resolving to a config file setting with default value.</jc>
1425       *    <ja>@Rest</ja>(defaultResponseHeaders={<js>"Content-Type: $C{REST/defaultContentType,text/plain}"</js>,<js>"My-Header: $C{REST/myHeaderValue}"</js>})
1426       *    <jk>public class</jk> MyResource {
1427       *
1428       *       <jc>// Option #2 - Defined via builder passed in through resource constructor.</jc>
1429       *       <jk>public</jk> MyResource(RestContext.Builder <jv>builder</jv>) <jk>throws</jk> Exception {
1430       *
1431       *          <jc>// Using method on builder.</jc>
1432       *          <jv>builder</jv>
1433       *             .defaultResponseHeaders(
1434       *                ContentType.<jsm>of</jsm>(<js>"text/plain"</js>),
1435       *                BasicHeader.<jsm>ofPair</jsm>(<js>"My-Header: foo"</js>)
1436       *             );
1437       *       }
1438       *
1439       *       <jc>// Option #3 - Defined via builder passed in through init method.</jc>
1440       *       <ja>@RestInit</ja>
1441       *       <jk>public void</jk> init(RestContext.Builder <jv>builder</jv>) <jk>throws</jk> Exception {
1442       *          <jv>builder</jv>.defaultResponseHeaders(ContentType.<jsm>of</jsm>(<js>"text/plain"</js>));
1443       *       }
1444       *    }
1445       * </p>
1446       *
1447       * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
1448       *    <li class='ja'>{@link Rest#defaultResponseHeaders}
1449       *    <li class='ja'>{@link RestOp#defaultResponseHeaders}
1450       *    <li class='ja'>{@link RestGet#defaultResponseHeaders}
1451       *    <li class='ja'>{@link RestPut#defaultResponseHeaders}
1452       *    <li class='ja'>{@link RestPost#defaultResponseHeaders}
1453       *    <li class='ja'>{@link RestDelete#defaultResponseHeaders}
1454       * </ul>
1455       *
1456       * @param values The headers to add.
1457       *    <br>Cannot contain <jk>null</jk> values.
1458       * @return This object.
1459       */
1460      public Builder defaultResponseHeaders(Header...values) {
1461         assertArgNoNulls("values", values);
1462         defaultResponseHeaders().setDefault(values);
1463         return this;
1464      }
1465
1466      /**
1467       * Sets a value in the default settings map.
1468       *
1469       * <p>
1470       * A shortcut for the following code:
1471       *
1472       * <p class='bjava'>
1473       *    <jv>builder</jv>.defaultSettings().add(<jv>key</jv>, <jv>value</jv>);
1474       *
1475       * </p>
1476       * @param key The setting key.
1477       *    <br>Cannot be <jk>null</jk>.
1478       * @param value The setting value.
1479       * @return This object.
1480       * @see #defaultSettings()
1481       */
1482      public Builder defaultSetting(String key, Object value) {
1483         defaultSettings().set(assertArgNotNull("key", key), value);
1484         return this;
1485      }

1488       * Returns the default settings map.
1489       *
1490       * <p>
1491       * Default settings are inherited from the parent REST object.
1492       * Typically used on the top-level {@link RestContext.Builder} to affect settings for that REST object and all children.
1493       *
1494       * <p>
1495       * Modifying the default settings map on this builder does not affect the default settings on the parent builder, but changes made
1496       * here are inherited by child builders.
1497       *
1498       * @return The default settings map.
1499       */
1500      public DefaultSettingsMap defaultSettings() {
1501         return defaultSettings;
1502      }

1511            destroyMethods = createDestroyMethods(beanStore(), resource());
1512         return destroyMethods;

1515      /**
1516       * Disable content URL parameter.
1517       *
1518       * <p>
1519       * When enabled, the HTTP content content on PUT and POST requests can be passed in as text using the <js>"content"</js>
1520       * URL parameter.
1521       * <br>
1522       * For example:
1523       * <p class='burlenc'>
1524       *  ?content=(name='John%20Smith',age=45)
1525       * </p>
1526       *
1527       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
1528       * <p class='bjava'>
1529       *    <jc>// Option #1 - Defined via annotation resolving to a config file setting with default value.</jc>
1530       *    <ja>@Rest</ja>(disableContentParam=<js>"$C{REST/disableContentParam,true}"</js>)
1531       *    <jk>public class</jk> MyResource {
1532       *
1533       *       <jc>// Option #2 - Defined via builder passed in through resource constructor.</jc>
1534       *       <jk>public</jk> MyResource(RestContext.Builder <jv>builder</jv>) <jk>throws</jk> Exception {
1535       *
1536       *          <jc>// Using method on builder.</jc>
1537       *          <jv>builder</jv>.disableContentParam();
1538       *       }
1539       *
1540       *       <jc>// Option #3 - Defined via builder passed in through init method.</jc>
1541       *       <ja>@RestInit</ja>
1542       *       <jk>public void</jk> init(RestContext.Builder <jv>builder</jv>) <jk>throws</jk> Exception {
1543       *          <jv>builder</jv>.disableContentParam();
1544       *       }
1545       *    }
1546       * </p>
1547       *
1548       * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
1549       *    <li class='note'>
1550       *       <js>'content'</js> parameter name is case-insensitive.
1551       *    <li class='note'>
1552       *       Useful for debugging PUT and POST methods using only a browser.
1553       * </ul>
1554       *
1555       * @return This object.
1556       */
1557      public Builder disableContentParam() {
1558         return disableContentParam(true);
1559      }
1560
1561      /**
1562       * Disable content URL parameter.
1563       *
1564       * <p>
1565       * Same as {@link #disableContentParam()} but allows you to set it as a boolean value.
1566       *
1567       * @param value The new value for this setting.
1568       * @return This object.
1569       */
1570      public Builder disableContentParam(boolean value) {
1571         disableContentParam = value;
1572         return this;
1573      }
1574
1575      /**
1576       * Returns the encoder group sub-builder.
1577       *
1578       * <p>
1579       * Encoders are used to decode HTTP requests and encode HTTP responses based on {@code Content-Encoding} and {@code Accept-Encoding}
1580       * headers.
1581       *
1582       * <p>
1583       * The default encoder set has support for identity incoding only.
1584       * It can be overridden via any of the following:
1585       * <ul class='spaced-list'>
1586       *    <li>Injected via bean store.
1587       *    <li>Class annotation: {@link Rest#encoders() @Rest(encoders)}
1588       *    <li>{@link RestInject @RestInject}-annotated method:
1589       *       <p class='bjava'>
1590       *    <ja>@RestInject</ja> <jk>public</jk> [<jk>static</jk>] EncoderSet myMethod(<i>&lt;args&gt;</i>) {...}
1591       *       </p>
1592       *       Args can be any injected bean including EncoderSet.Builder, the default builder.
1593       * </ul>
1594       *
1595       * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
1596       *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/RestServerEncoders">Encoders</a>
1597       * </ul>
1598       *
1599       * @return The builder for the {@link EncoderSet} object in the REST context.
1600       */
1601      public EncoderSet.Builder encoders() {
1602         if (encoders == null)
1603            encoders = createEncoders(beanStore(), resource());
1604         return encoders;
1605      }
1606
1607      /**
1608       * Adds one or more encoders to this class.
1609       *
1610       * <p>
1611       * Equivalent to calling:
1612       * <p class='bjava'>
1613       *    <jv>builder</jv>.encoders().add(<jv>value</jv>);
1614       * </p>
1615       *
1616       * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
1617       *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/RestServerEncoders">Encoders</a>
1618       *    <li class='jm'>{@link #encoders()}
1619       * </ul>
1620       *
1621       * @param value The values to add.
1622       *    <br>Cannot contain <jk>null</jk> values.
1623       * @return This object.
1624       */
1625      @SafeVarargs
1626      public final Builder encoders(Class<? extends Encoder>...value) {
1627         assertArgNoNulls("value", value);
1628         encoders().add(value);
1629         return this;
1630      }
1631
1632      /**
1633       * Adds one or more encoders to this class.
1634       *
1635       * <p>
1636       * Equivalent to calling:
1637       * <p class='bjava'>
1638       *    <jv>builder</jv>.encoders().add(<jv>value</jv>);
1639       * </p>
1640       *
1641       * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
1642       *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/RestServerEncoders">Encoders</a>
1643       *    <li class='jm'>{@link #encoders()}
1644       * </ul>
1645       *
1646       * @param value The values to add.
1647       *    <br>Cannot contain <jk>null</jk> values.
1648       * @return This object.
1649       */
1650      public Builder encoders(Encoder...value) {
1651         assertArgNoNulls("value", value);
1652         encoders().add(value);
1653         return this;
1654      }

1667      /**
1668       * Returns the encoder group builder containing the encoders for compressing/decompressing input and output streams.
1669       *
1670       * <p>
1671       * These can be used to enable various kinds of compression (e.g. <js>"gzip"</js>) on requests and responses.
1672       *
1673       * <p>
1674       * The builder is initialized with encoders defined via the {@link Rest#encoders()} annotation.  That annotation is applied
1675       * from parent-to-child order with child entries given priority over parent entries.
1676       *
1677       * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
1678       *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/RestServerEncoders">Encoders</a>
1679       * </ul>
1680       *
1681       * @return The encoder group builder for this context builder.
1682       */
1683      public EncoderSet.Builder getEncoders() { return encoders; }

1685      @Override /* Overridden from ServletConfig */
1686      public String getInitParameter(String name) {
1687         return inner == null ? null : inner.getInitParameter(name);
1688      }
1689
1690      @Override /* Overridden from ServletConfig */
1691      public Enumeration<String> getInitParameterNames() { return inner == null ? new Vector<String>().elements() : inner.getInitParameterNames(); }
1692
1693      /**
1694       * Returns the parser group builder containing the parsers for converting HTTP request bodies into POJOs.
1695       *
1696       * <p>
1697       * Parsers are used to convert the content of HTTP requests into POJOs.
1698       * <br>Any of the Juneau framework parsers can be used in this setting.
1699       * <br>The parser selected is based on the request <c>Content-Type</c> header matched against the values returned by the following method
1700       * using a best-match algorithm:
1701       * <ul class='javatree'>
1702       *    <li class='jm'>{@link Parser#getMediaTypes()}
1703       * </ul>
1704       *
1705       * <p>
1706       * The builder is initialized with parsers defined via the {@link Rest#parsers()} annotation.  That annotation is applied
1707       * from parent-to-child order with child entries given priority over parent entries.
1708       *
1709       * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
1710       *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/Marshalling">Marshalling</a>
1711       * </ul>
1712       *
1713       * @return The parser group builder for this context builder.
1714       */
1715      public ParserSet.Builder getParsers() { return parsers; }
1716
1717      /**
1718       * Returns the serializer group builder containing the serializers for marshalling POJOs into response bodies.
1719       *
1720       * <p>
1721       * Serializer are used to convert POJOs to HTTP response bodies.
1722       * <br>Any of the Juneau framework serializers can be used in this setting.
1723       * <br>The serializer selected is based on the request <c>Accept</c> header matched against the values returned by the following method
1724       * using a best-match algorithm:
1725       * <ul class='javatree'>
1726       *    <li class='jm'>{@link Serializer#getMediaTypeRanges()}
1727       * </ul>
1728       *
1729       * <p>
1730       * The builder is initialized with serializers defined via the {@link Rest#serializers()} annotation.  That annotation is applied
1731       * from parent-to-child order with child entries given priority over parent entries.
1732       *
1733       * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
1734       *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/Marshalling">Marshalling</a>
1735       * </ul>
1736       *
1737       * @return The serializer group builder for this context builder.
1738       */
1739      public SerializerSet.Builder getSerializers() { return serializers; }
1740
1741      @Override /* Overridden from ServletConfig */
1742      public ServletContext getServletContext() {
1743         return nn(inner) ? inner.getServletContext() : nn(parentContext) ? parentContext.getBuilder().getServletContext() : null;
1744      }
1745
1746      @Override /* Overridden from ServletConfig */
1747      public String getServletName() { return inner == null ? null : inner.getServletName(); }
1748
1749      @Override /* Overridden from Builder */
1750      public Builder impl(Context value) {
1751         super.impl(value);
1752         return this;
1753      }
1754
1755      /**
1756       * Performs initialization on this builder against the specified REST servlet/bean instance.
1757       *
1758       * @param resource
1759       *    The REST servlet/bean instance that this context is defined against.
1760       *    <br>Cannot be <jk>null</jk>.
1761       * @return This object.
1762       * @throws ServletException If hook method calls failed.
1763       */
1764      public Builder init(Supplier<?> resource) throws ServletException {
1765
1766         if (initialized)
1767            return this;
1768         initialized = true;
1769
1770         this.resource = new ResourceSupplier(resourceClass, assertArgNotNull("resource", resource));
1771         var r = this.resource;
1772         var rc = resourceClass;
1773
1774         // @formatter:off
1775         beanStore = createBeanStore(resource)
1776            .build()
1777            .addBean(Builder.class, this)
1778            .addBean(ResourceSupplier.class, this.resource)
1779            .addBean(ServletConfig.class, nn(inner) ? inner : this)
1780            .addBean(ServletContext.class, (nn(inner) ? inner : this).getServletContext());
1781         // @formatter:on
1782
1783         if (rootBeanStore == null) {
1784            rootBeanStore = beanStore;
1785            beanStore = BeanStore.of(rootBeanStore, r.get());
1786         }
1787         var bs = beanStore;
1788
1789         beanStore.add(BeanStore.class, bs);
1790         varResolver = createVarResolver(bs, r, rc);
1791         beanStore.add(VarResolver.class, varResolver.build());
1792         config = beanStore.add(Config.class, createConfig(bs, r, rc));
1793         beanStore.add(VarResolver.class, varResolver.bean(Config.class, config).build());
1794
1795         var rci = ClassInfo.of(resourceClass);
1796
1797         // Get @RestInject fields initialized with values.
1798         // @formatter:off
1799         rci.getAllFields().stream()
1800            .filter(x -> x.hasAnnotation(RestInject.class))
1801            .forEach(x -> opt(x.get(resource.get())).ifPresent(
1802               y -> beanStore.add(
1803                  x.getFieldType().inner(),
1804                  y,
1805                  RestInjectAnnotation.name(x.getAnnotations(RestInject.class).findFirst().map(AnnotationInfo::inner).orElse(null))
1806               )
1807            ));
1808         // @formatter:on
1809
1810         rci.getAllMethods().stream().filter(x -> x.hasAnnotation(RestInject.class)).forEach(x -> {
1811            var rt = x.getReturnType().<Object>inner();
1812            var name = RestInjectAnnotation.name(x.getAnnotations(RestInject.class).findFirst().map(AnnotationInfo::inner).orElse(null));
1813            if (! (DELAYED_INJECTION.contains(rt) || DELAYED_INJECTION_NAMES.contains(name))) {
1814               // @formatter:off
1815               beanStore
1816                  .createMethodFinder(rt)
1817                  .find(Builder::isRestBeanMethod)
1818                  .run(y -> beanStore.add(rt, y, name));
1819               // @formatter:on
1820            }
1821         });
1822
1823         var vrs = varResolver().build().createSession();
1824         var work = AnnotationWorkList.of(vrs, rstream(AP.find(rci)).filter(CONTEXT_APPLY_FILTER));
1825
1826         apply(work);
1827         beanContext().apply(work);
1828         partSerializer().apply(work);
1829         partParser().apply(work);
1830         jsonSchemaGenerator().apply(work);
1831
1832         runInitHooks(bs, resource());
1833
1834         // Set @RestInject fields not initialized with values.
1835         // @formatter:off
1836         rci.getAllFields().stream()
1837            .filter(x -> x.hasAnnotation(RestInject.class))
1838            .forEach(x -> x.setIfNull(
1839               resource.get(),
1840               beanStore.getBean(
1841                  x.getFieldType().inner(),
1842                  RestInjectAnnotation.name(x.getAnnotations(RestInject.class).findFirst().map(AnnotationInfo::inner).orElse(null))
1843               ).orElse(null)
1844            ));
1845         // @formatter:on
1846
1847         return this;
1848      }
1849
1850      /**
1851       * Returns the JSON schema generator sub-builder.
1852       *
1853       * <p>
1854       * The JSON schema generator is used for generating JSON schema in the auto-generated Swagger documentation.
1855       *
1856       * <p>
1857       * The default JSON schema generator is a default {@link JsonSchemaGenerator}.
1858       * It can overridden via any of the following:
1859       * <ul class='spaced-list'>
1860       *    <li>Injected via bean store.
1861       *    <li>{@link RestInject @RestInject}-annotated method:
1862       *       <p class='bjava'>
1863       *    <ja>@RestInject</ja> <jk>public</jk> [<jk>static</jk>] JsonSchemaGenerator myMethod(<i>&lt;args&gt;</i>) {...}
1864       *       </p>
1865       *       Args can be any injected bean including JsonSchemaGenerator.Builder, the default builder.
1866       * </ul>
1867       *
1868       * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
1869       *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/JuneauBeanSwagger2">juneau-bean-swagger-v2</a>
1870       * </ul>
1871       *
1872       * @return The JSON schema generator sub-builder.
1873       */
1874      public JsonSchemaGenerator.Builder jsonSchemaGenerator() {
1875         if (jsonSchemaGenerator == null)
1876            jsonSchemaGenerator = createJsonSchemaGenerator(beanStore(), resource());
1877         return jsonSchemaGenerator;
1878      }

1926      /**
1927       * Returns the logger for this resource.
1928       *
1929       * <p>
1930       * The logger is used in the following locations:
1931       * <ul>
1932       *    <li>{@link RestServlet#log(Level, Throwable, String, Object...)} and related methods.
1933       *    <li>{@link RestObject#log(Level, Throwable, String, Object...)} and related methods.
1934       *    <li>In the {@link #callLogger()} of this resource.
1935       * </ul>
1936       * It can also be accessed directly via {@link RestContext#getLogger()} or passed in as a parameter
1937       * on a {@link RestOp}-annotated method.
1938       *
1939       * <p>
1940       * The default config can be overridden via any of the following:
1941       * <ul class='spaced-list'>
1942       *    <li>Injected via bean store.
1943       *    <li>{@link RestInject @RestInject}-annotated method:
1944       *       <p class='bjava'>
1945       *    <ja>@RestInject</ja> <jk>public</jk> [<jk>static</jk>] Logger myMethod(<i>&lt;args&gt;</i>) {...}
1946       *       </p>
1947       *       Args can be any injected bean.
1948       * </ul>
1949       *
1950       * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
1951       *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/RestServerLoggingAndDebugging">Logging / Debugging</a>
1952       * </ul>
1953       *
1954       * @return The logger for this resource.
1955       */
1956      public Logger logger() {
1957         if (logger == null)
1958            logger = createLogger(beanStore(), resource, resourceClass);
1959         return logger;
1960      }
1961
1962      /**
1963       * Sets the logger for this resource.
1964       *
1965       * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
1966       *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/RestServerLoggingAndDebugging">Logging / Debugging</a>
1967       *    <li class='jm'>{@link #logger()}
1968       * </ul>
1969       *
1970       * @param value The logger to use for the REST resource.
1971       *    <br>Cannot be <jk>null</jk>.
1972       * @return This object.
1973       */
1974      public Builder logger(Logger value) {
1975         logger = assertArgNotNull("value", value);
1976         return this;
1977      }
