1979      /**
1980       * The maximum allowed input size (in bytes) on HTTP requests.
1981       *
1982       * <p>
1983       * Useful for alleviating DoS attacks by throwing an exception when too much input is received instead of resulting
1984       * in out-of-memory errors which could affect system stability.
1985       *
1986       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
1987       * <p class='bjava'>
1988       *    <jc>// Option #1 - Defined via annotation resolving to a config file setting with default value.</jc>
1989       *    <ja>@Rest</ja>(maxInput=<js>"$C{REST/maxInput,10M}"</js>)
1990       *    <jk>public class</jk> MyResource {
1991       *
1992       *       <jc>// Option #2 - Defined via builder passed in through resource constructor.</jc>
1993       *       <jk>public</jk> MyResource(RestContext.Builder <jv>builder</jv>) <jk>throws</jk> Exception {
1994       *
1995       *          <jc>// Using method on builder.</jc>
1996       *          <jv>builder</jv>.maxInput(<js>"10M"</js>);
1997       *       }
1998       *
1999       *       <jc>// Option #3 - Defined via builder passed in through init method.</jc>
2000       *       <ja>@RestInit</ja>
2001       *       <jk>public void</jk> init(RestContext.Builder <jv>builder</jv>) <jk>throws</jk> Exception {
2002       *          <jv>builder</jv>.maxInput(<js>"10M"</js>);
2003       *       }
2004       *
2005       *       <jc>// Override at the method level.</jc>
2006       *       <ja>@RestPost</ja>(maxInput=<js>"10M"</js>)
2007       *       <jk>public</jk> Object myMethod() {...}
2008       *    }
2009       * </p>
2010       *
2011       * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
2012       *    <li class='note'>
2013       *       String value that gets resolved to a <jk>long</jk>.
2014       *    <li class='note'>
2015       *       Can be suffixed with any of the following representing kilobytes, megabytes, and gigabytes:
2016       *       <js>'K'</js>, <js>'M'</js>, <js>'G'</js>.
2017       *    <li class='note'>
2018       *       A value of <js>"-1"</js> can be used to represent no limit.
2019       * </ul>
2020       *
2021       * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
2022       *    <li class='ja'>{@link Rest#maxInput}
2023       *    <li class='ja'>{@link RestOp#maxInput}
2024       *    <li class='jm'>{@link RestOpContext.Builder#maxInput(String)}
2025       * </ul>
2026       *
2027       * @param value
2028       *    The new value for this setting.
2029       *    <br>The default is the first value found:
2030       *    <ul>
2031       *       <li>System property <js>"RestContext.maxInput"
2032       *       <li>Environment variable <js>"RESTCONTEXT_MAXINPUT"
2033       *       <li><js>"100M"</js>
2034       *    </ul>
2035       *    <br>The default is <js>"100M"</js>.
2036       *    <br>Cannot be <jk>null</jk>.
2037       * @return This object.
2038       */
2039      public Builder maxInput(String value) {
2040         maxInput = StringUtils.parseLongWithSuffix(assertArgNotNull("value", value));
2041         return this;
2042      }
2043
2044      /**
2045       * Returns the messages sub-builder.
2046       *
2047       * <p>
2048       * Messages beans are wrappers around resource bundles containing localized messages.
2049       *
2050       * <p>
2051       * By default, the resource bundle name is assumed to match the class name.  For example, given the class
2052       * <c>MyClass.java</c>, the resource bundle is assumed to be <c>MyClass.properties</c>.  This property
2053       * allows you to override this setting to specify a different location such as <c>MyMessages.properties</c> by
2054       * specifying a value of <js>"MyMessages"</js>.
2055       *
2056       * <p>
2057       *    Resource bundles are searched using the following base name patterns:
2058       *    <ul>
2059       *       <li><js>"{package}.{name}"</js>
2060       *       <li><js>"{package}.i18n.{name}"</js>
2061       *       <li><js>"{package}.nls.{name}"</js>
2062       *       <li><js>"{package}.messages.{name}"</js>
2063       *    </ul>
2064       *
2065       * <p>
2066       * This annotation is used to provide request-localized (based on <c>Accept-Language</c>) messages for the following methods:
2067       * <ul class='javatree'>
2068       *    <li class='jm'>{@link RestRequest#getMessage(String, Object...)}
2069       *    <li class='jm'>{@link RestContext#getMessages() RestContext.getMessages()}
2070       * </ul>
2071       *
2072       * <p>
2073       * Request-localized messages are also available by passing either of the following parameter types into your Java method:
2074       * <ul class='javatree'>
2075       *    <li class='jc'>{@link ResourceBundle} - Basic Java resource bundle.
2076       *    <li class='jc'>{@link Messages} - Extended resource bundle with several convenience methods.
2077       * </ul>
2078       *
2079       * The value can be a relative path like <js>"nls/Messages"</js>, indicating to look for the resource bundle
2080       * <js>"com.foo.sample.nls.Messages"</js> if the resource class is in <js>"com.foo.sample"</js>, or it can be an
2081       * absolute path like <js>"com.foo.sample.nls.Messages"</js>
2082       *
2083       * <h5 class='section'>Examples:</h5>
2084       * <p class='bini'>
2085       *    <cc># Contents of org/apache/foo/nls/MyMessages.properties</cc>
2086       *
2087       *    <ck>HelloMessage</ck> = <cv>Hello {0}!</cv>
2088       * </p>
2089       * <p class='bjava'>
2090       *    <jc>// Contents of org/apache/foo/MyResource.java</jc>
2091       *
2092       *    <ja>@Rest</ja>(messages=<js>"nls/MyMessages"</js>)
2093       *    <jk>public class</jk> MyResource {...}
2094       *
2095       *       <ja>@RestGet</ja>(<js>"/hello/{you}"</js>)
2096       *       <jk>public</jk> Object helloYou(RestRequest <jv>req</jv>, Messages <jv>messages</jv>, <ja>@Path</ja>(<js>"name"</js>) String <jv>you</jv>) {
2097       *          String <jv>string</jv>;
2098       *
2099       *          <jc>// Get it from the RestRequest object.</jc>
2100       *          <jv>string</jv> = <jv>req</jv>.getMessage(<js>"HelloMessage"</js>, <jv>you</jv>);
2101       *
2102       *          <jc>// Or get it from the method parameter.</jc>
2103       *          <jv>string</jv> = <jv>messages</jv>.getString(<js>"HelloMessage"</js>, <jv>you</jv>);
2104       *
2105       *          <jc>// Or get the message in a locale different from the request.</jc>
2106       *          <jv>string</jv> = <jv>messages</jv>.forLocale(Locale.<jsf>UK</jsf>).getString(<js>"HelloMessage"</js>, <jv>you</jv>);
2107       *
2108       *          <jk>return</jk> <jv>string</jv>;
2109       *       }
2110       *    }
2111       * </p>
2112       *
2113       * <p>
2114       * The default messages can overridden via any of the following:
2115       * <ul class='spaced-list'>
2116       *    <li>Injected via bean store.
2117       *    <li>Class annotation:  {@link Rest#messages() @Rest(messages)}
2118       *    <li>{@link RestInject @RestInject}-annotated method:
2119       *       <p class='bjava'>
2120       *    <ja>@RestInject</ja> <jk>public</jk> [<jk>static</jk>] Messages myMethod(<i>&lt;args&gt;</i>) {...}
2121       *       </p>
2122       *       Args can be any injected bean including Messages.Builder, the default builder.
2123       * </ul>
2124       *
2125       * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
2126       *    <li class='note'>Mappings are cumulative from super classes.
2127       *       <br>Therefore, you can find and retrieve messages up the class-hierarchy chain.
2128       * </ul>
2129       *
2130       * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
2131       *    <li class='jc'>{@link Messages}
2132       *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/LocalizedMessages">Localized Messages</a>
2133       * </ul>
2134       *
2135       * @return The messages sub-builder.
2136       */
2137      public Messages.Builder messages() {
2138         if (messages == null)
2139            messages = createMessages(beanStore(), resource());
2140         return messages;
2141      }
2142

2146       * <p>

2266      /**
2267       * <i><l>RestContext</l> configuration property:&emsp;</i>  Parser listener.
2268       *
2269       * <p>
2270       * Specifies the parser listener class to use for listening to non-fatal parsing errors.
2271       *
2272       * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
2273       *    <li class='jm'>{@link org.apache.juneau.parser.Parser.Builder#listener(Class)}
2274       * </ul>
2275       *
2276       * @param value The new value for this setting.
2277       *    <br>Cannot be <jk>null</jk>.
2278       * @return This object.
2279       */
2280      public Builder parserListener(Class<? extends ParserListener> value) {
2281         if (isNotVoid(assertArgNotNull("value", value)))
2282            parsers.forEach(x -> x.listener(value));
2283         return this;
2284      }
2285
2286      /**
2287       * Returns the parser group sub-builder.
2288       *
2289       * <p>
2290       * Parsers are used to HTTP request bodies into POJOs based on the {@code Content-Type} header.
2291       *
2292       * <p>
2293       * The default parser set is empty.
2294       * It can be overridden via any of the following:
2295       * <ul class='spaced-list'>
2296       *    <li>Injected via bean store.
2297       *    <li>Class annotation: {@link Rest#parsers() @Rest(parsers)}
2298       *    <li>{@link RestInject @RestInject}-annotated method:
2299       *       <p class='bjava'>
2300       *    <ja>@RestInject</ja> <jk>public</jk> [<jk>static</jk>] ParserSet myMethod(<i>&lt;args&gt;</i>) {...}
2301       *       </p>
2302       *       Args can be any injected bean including ParserSet.Builder, the default builder.
2303       * </ul>
2304       *
2305       * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
2306       *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/Marshalling">Marshalling</a>
2307       * </ul>
2308       *
2309       * @return The parser group sub-builder.
2310       */
2311      public ParserSet.Builder parsers() {
2312         if (parsers == null)
2313            parsers = createParsers(beanStore(), resource());
2314         return parsers;
2315      }
2316
2317      /**
2318       * Adds one or more parsers to this class.
2319       *
2320       * <p>
2321       * Equivalent to calling:
2322       * <p class='bjava'>
2323       *    <jv>builder</jv>.parsers().add(<jv>value</jv>);
2324       * </p>
2325       *
2326       * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
2327       *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/Marshalling">Marshalling</a>
2328       *    <li class='jm'>{@link #parsers()}
2329       * </ul>
2330       *
2331       * @param value The values to add.
2332       *    <br>Cannot contain <jk>null</jk> values.
2333       * @return This object.
2334       */
2335      @SafeVarargs
2336      public final Builder parsers(Class<? extends Parser>...value) {
2337         assertArgNoNulls("value", value);
2338         parsers().add(value);
2339         return this;
2340      }
2341
2342      /**
2343       * Adds one or more parsers to this class.
2344       *
2345       * <p>
2346       * Equivalent to calling:
2347       * <p class='bjava'>
2348       *    <jv>builder</jv>.parsers().add(<jv>value</jv>);
2349       * </p>
2350       *
2351       * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>

2354       * </ul>
2355       *

2357       *    <br>Cannot contain <jk>null</jk> values.
2358       * @return This object.
2359       */
2360      public Builder parsers(Parser...value) {
2361         assertArgNoNulls("value", value);
2362         parsers().add(value);
2363         return this;
2364      }

2366      /**
2367       * Returns the part parser sub-builder.
2368       *
2369       * <p>
2370       * The part parser is used for parsing HTTP parts such as request headers and query/form/path parameters.
2371       *
2372       * <p>
2373       * The default part parser is an {@link OpenApiParser}.
2374       * It can overridden via any of the following:
2375       * <ul class='spaced-list'>
2376       *    <li>Injected via bean store.
2377       *    <li>{@link RestInject @RestInject}-annotated method:
2378       *       <p class='bjava'>
2379       *    <ja>@RestInject</ja> <jk>public</jk> [<jk>static</jk>] HttpPartParser myMethod(<i>&lt;args&gt;</i>) {...}
2380       *       </p>
2381       *       Args can be any injected bean including HttpPartParser.Builder, the default builder.
2382       * </ul>
2383       *
2384       * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
2385       *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/HttpParts">HTTP Parts</a>
2386       * </ul>
2387       *
2388       * @return The part parser sub-builder.
2389       */
2390      public HttpPartParser.Creator partParser() {
2391         if (partParser == null)
2392            partParser = createPartParser(beanStore(), resource());
2393         return partParser;
2394      }

2456       *       </p>
2457       *       Args can be any injected bean including HttpPartSerializer.Builder, the default builder.
2458       * </ul>
2459       *
2460       * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
2461       *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/HttpParts">HTTP Parts</a>
2462       * </ul>
2463       *

2465       */

2517
2518      /**
2519       * Resource path.
2520       *
2521       * <p>
2522       * Identifies the URL subpath relative to the parent resource.
2523       *
2524       * <p>
2525       * This setting is critical for the routing of HTTP requests from ascendant to child resources.
2526       *
2527       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
2528       * <p class='bjava'>
2529       *    <jc>// Option #1 - Defined via annotation.</jc>
2530       *    <ja>@Rest</ja>(path=<js>"/myResource"</js>)
2531       *    <jk>public class</jk> MyResource {
2532       *
2533       *       <jc>// Option #2 - Defined via builder passed in through resource constructor.</jc>
2534       *       <jk>public</jk> MyResource(RestContext.Builder <jv>builder</jv>) <jk>throws</jk> Exception {
2535       *
2536       *          <jc>// Using method on builder.</jc>
2537       *          <jv>builder</jv>.path(<js>"/myResource"</js>);
2538       *       }
2539       *
2540       *       <jc>// Option #3 - Defined via builder passed in through init method.</jc>
2541       *       <ja>@RestInit</ja>
2542       *       <jk>public void</jk> init(RestContext.Builder <jv>builder</jv>) <jk>throws</jk> Exception {
2543       *          <jv>builder</jv>.path(<js>"/myResource"</js>);
2544       *       }
2545       *    }
2546       * </p>
2547       *
2548       * <p>
2549       * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
2550       *    <li class='note'>
2551       *       This annotation is ignored on top-level servlets (i.e. servlets defined in <c>web.xml</c> files).
2552       *       <br>Therefore, implementers can optionally specify a path value for documentation purposes.
2553       *    <li class='note'>
2554       *       Typically, this setting is only applicable to resources defined as children through the
2555       *       {@link Rest#children() @Rest(children)} annotation.
2556       *       <br>However, it may be used in other ways (e.g. defining paths for top-level resources in microservices).
2557       *    <li class='note'>
2558       *       Slashes are trimmed from the path ends.
2559       *       <br>As a convention, you may want to start your path with <js>'/'</js> simple because it make it easier to read.
2560       *    <li class='note'>
2561       *       This path is available through the following method:
2562       *       <ul>
2563       *          <li class='jm'>{@link RestContext#getPath() RestContext.getPath()}
2564       *       </ul>
2565       * </ul>
2566       *
2567       * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
2568       *    <li class='ja'>{@link Rest#path}
2569       * </ul>
2570       *
2571       * @param value The new value for this setting.
2572       *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk> or empty (path will not be set, defaults to empty string).
2573       * @return This object.
2574       */
2575      public Builder path(String value) {
2576         value = trimLeadingSlashes(value);
2577         if (ne(value))
2578            path = value;
2579         return this;
2580      }
2581
2582      /**
2583       * Returns the post-call method list.
2584       *
2585       * <p>
2586       * The list of methods that gets called immediately after the <ja>@RestOp</ja> annotated method gets called..
2587       *
2588       * @return The list of methods that gets called immediately after the <ja>@RestOp</ja> annotated method gets called..
2589       */
2590      public MethodList postCallMethods() {
2591         if (postCallMethods == null)
2592            postCallMethods = createPostCallMethods(beanStore(), resource());
2593         return postCallMethods;
2594      }

2600       */

2602         if (postInitChildFirstMethods == null)
2603            postInitChildFirstMethods = createPostInitChildFirstMethods(beanStore(), resource());
2604         return postInitChildFirstMethods;
2605      }

2632      /**
2633       * Returns the media types produced by this resource if it's manually specified.
2634       *
2635       * @return The media types.
2636       */
2637      public Optional<List<MediaType>> produces() {
2638         return opt(produces);
2639      }
2640
2641      /**
2642       * Supported accept media types.
2643       *
2644       * <p>
2645       * Overrides the media types inferred from the serializers that identify what media types can be produced by the resource.
2646       * <br>An example where this might be useful if you have serializers registered that handle media types that you
2647       * don't want exposed in the Swagger documentation.
2648       *
2649       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
2650       * <p class='bjava'>
2651       *    <jc>// Option #1 - Defined via annotation resolving to a config file setting with default value.</jc>
2652       *    <ja>@Rest</ja>(produces={<js>"$C{REST/supportedProduces,application/json}"</js>})
2653       *    <jk>public class</jk> MyResource {
2654       *
2655       *       <jc>// Option #2 - Defined via builder passed in through resource constructor.</jc>
2656       *       <jk>public</jk> MyResource(RestContext.Builder <jv>builder</jv>) <jk>throws</jk> Exception {
2657       *
2658       *          <jc>// Using method on builder.</jc>
2659       *          <jv>builder</jv>.produces(<jk>false</jk>, <js>"application/json"</js>)
2660       *       }
2661       *
2662       *       <jc>// Option #3 - Defined via builder passed in through init method.</jc>
2663       *       <ja>@RestInit</ja>
2664       *       <jk>public void</jk> init(RestContext.Builder <jv>builder</jv>) <jk>throws</jk> Exception {
2665       *          <jv>builder</jv>.produces(<jk>false</jk>, <js>"application/json"</js>);
2666       *       }
2667       *    }
2668       * </p>
2669       *
2670       * <p>
2671       * This affects the returned values from the following:
2672       * <ul class='javatree'>
2673       *    <li class='jm'>{@link RestContext#getProduces() RestContext.getProduces()}
2674       *    <li class='jm'>{@link SwaggerProvider#getSwagger(RestContext,Locale)} - Affects produces field.
2675       * </ul>
2676       *
2677       * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
2678       *    <li class='ja'>{@link Rest#produces}
2679       *    <li class='ja'>{@link RestOp#produces}
2680       *    <li class='ja'>{@link RestGet#produces}
2681       *    <li class='ja'>{@link RestPut#produces}
2682       *    <li class='ja'>{@link RestPost#produces}
2683       * </ul>
2684       *
2685       * @param values The values to add to this setting.
2686       *    <br>Cannot contain <jk>null</jk> values.
2687       * @return This object.
2688       */
2689      public Builder produces(MediaType...values) {
2690         assertArgNoNulls("values", values);
2691         produces = addAll(produces, values);
2692         return this;
2693      }
2694
2695      /**
2696       * <i><l>RestContext</l> configuration property:&emsp;</i>  Render response stack traces in responses.
2697       *
2698       * <p>
2699       * Shortcut for calling <code>renderResponseStackTraces(<jk>true</jk>)</code>.
2700       *
2701       * @return This object.
2702       */
2703      public Builder renderResponseStackTraces() {
2704         renderResponseStackTraces = true;
2705         return this;
2706      }
2707
2708      /**
2709       * <i><l>RestContext</l> configuration property:&emsp;</i>  Render response stack traces in responses.
2710       *
2711       * <p>
2712       * Render stack traces in HTTP response bodies when errors occur.
2713       *
2714       * @param value
2715       *    The new value for this setting.
2716       *    <br>The default is <jk>false</jk>.
2717       * @return This object.
2718       */
2719      public Builder renderResponseStackTraces(boolean value) {
2720         renderResponseStackTraces = value;
2721         return this;
2722      }
2723
2724      /**
2725       * Returns the REST servlet/bean instance that this context is defined against.
2726       *
2727       * @return The REST servlet/bean instance that this context is defined against.
2728       */
2729      public Supplier<?> resource() {
2730         return Objects.requireNonNull(resource, "Resource not available. init(Object) has not been called.");
2731      }
2732
2733      /**
2734       * Returns the REST servlet/bean instance that this context is defined against if it's the specified type.
2735       *
2736       * @param <T> The expected type of the resource bean.
2737       * @param type The expected type of the resource bean.
2738       *    <br>Cannot be <jk>null</jk>.
2739       * @return The bean cast to that instance, or {@link Optional#empty()} if it's not the specified type.
2740       */
2741      public <T> Optional<T> resourceAs(Class<T> type) {
2742         var r = resource().get();
2743         return opt(assertArgNotNull("type", type).isInstance(r) ? type.cast(r) : null);
2744      }
2745
2746      /**
2747       * Returns the response processor list sub-builder.
2748       *
2749       * <p>
2750       * Specifies a list of {@link ResponseProcessor} classes that know how to convert POJOs returned by REST methods or
2751       * set via {@link RestResponse#setContent(Object)} into appropriate HTTP responses.
2752       *
2753       * <p>
2754       * By default, the following response handlers are provided in the specified order:
2755       * <ul class='javatreec'>
2756       *    <li class='jc'>{@link ReaderProcessor}
2757       *    <li class='jc'>{@link InputStreamProcessor}
2758       *    <li class='jc'>{@link ThrowableProcessor}
2759       *    <li class='jc'>{@link HttpResponseProcessor}
2760       *    <li class='jc'>{@link HttpResourceProcessor}
2761       *    <li class='jc'>{@link HttpEntityProcessor}
2762       *    <li class='jc'>{@link ResponseBeanProcessor}
2763       *    <li class='jc'>{@link PlainTextPojoProcessor}
2764       *    <li class='jc'>{@link SerializedPojoProcessor}
2765       * </ul>
2766       *
2767       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
2768       * <p class='bjava'>
2769       *    <jc>// Our custom response processor for Foo objects. </jc>
2770       *    <jk>public class</jk> MyResponseProcessor <jk>implements</jk> ResponseProcessor {
2771       *
2772       *       <ja>@Override</ja>
2773       *       <jk>public int</jk> process(RestOpSession <jv>opSession</jv>) <jk>throws</jk> IOException {
2774       *
2775       *             RestResponse <jv>res</jv> = <jv>opSession</jv>.getResponse();
2776       *             Foo <jv>foo</jv> = <jv>res</jv>.getOutput(Foo.<jk>class</jk>);
2777       *
2778       *             <jk>if</jk> (<jv>foo</jv> == <jk>null</jk>)
2779       *                <jk>return</jk> <jsf>NEXT</jsf>;  <jc>// Let the next processor handle it.</jc>
2780       *
2781       *             <jk>try</jk> (Writer <jv>writer</jv> = <jv>res</jv>.getNegotiatedWriter()) {
2782       *                <jc>//Pipe it to the writer ourselves.</jc>
2783       *             }
2784       *
2785       *             <jk>return</jk> <jsf>FINISHED</jsf>;  <jc>// We handled it.</jc>
2786       *       }
2787       *       }
2788       *    }
2789       *
2790       *    <jc>// Option #1 - Defined via annotation.</jc>
2791       *    <ja>@Rest</ja>(responseProcessors=MyResponseProcessor.<jk>class</jk>)
2792       *    <jk>public class</jk> MyResource {
2793       *
2794       *       <jc>// Option #2 - Defined via builder passed in through init method.</jc>
2795       *       <ja>@RestInit</ja>
2796       *       <jk>public void</jk> init(RestContext.Builder <jv>builder</jv>) <jk>throws</jk> Exception {
2797       *          <jv>builder</jv>.responseProcessors(MyResponseProcessors.<jk>class</jk>);
2798       *       }
2799       *
2800       *       <ja>@RestGet</ja>(...)
2801       *       <jk>public</jk> Object myMethod() {
2802       *          <jc>// Return a special object for our handler.</jc>
2803       *          <jk>return new</jk> MySpecialObject();
2804       *       }
2805       *    }
2806       * </p>
2807       *
2808       * <p>
2809       * The default response processors can overridden via any of the following:
2810       * <ul class='spaced-list'>
2811       *    <li>Injected via bean store.
2812       *    <li>Class annotation:  {@link Rest#responseProcessors() @Rest(responseProcessors)}
2813       *    <li>{@link RestInject @RestInject}-annotated method:
2814       *       <p class='bjava'>
2815       *    <ja>@RestInject</ja> <jk>public</jk> [<jk>static</jk>] ResponseProcessorList myMethod(<i>&lt;args&gt;</i>) {...}
2816       *       </p>
2817       *       Args can be any injected bean including ResponseProcessorList.Builder, the default builder.
2818       * </ul>
2819       *
2820       * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
2821       *    <li class='note'>
2822       *       Response processors are always inherited from ascendant resources.
2823       *    <li class='note'>
2824       *       When defined as a class, the implementation must have one of the following constructors:
2825       *       <ul>
2826       *          <li><code><jk>public</jk> T(RestContext)</code>
2827       *          <li><code><jk>public</jk> T()</code>
2828       *          <li><code><jk>public static</jk> T <jsm>create</jsm>(RestContext)</code>
2829       *          <li><code><jk>public static</jk> T <jsm>create</jsm>()</code>
2830       *       </ul>
2831       *    <li class='note'>
2832       *       Inner classes of the REST resource class are allowed.
2833       * </ul>
2834       *
2835       * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
2836       *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/ResponseProcessors">Response Processors</a>
2837       * </ul>
2838       *
2839       * @return The response processor list sub-builder.
2840       */
2841      public ResponseProcessorList.Builder responseProcessors() {
2842         if (responseProcessors == null)
2843            responseProcessors = createResponseProcessors(beanStore(), resource());
2844         return responseProcessors;

2910      /**
2911       * REST children class.
2912       *
2913       * <p>
2914       * Allows you to extend the {@link RestChildren} class to modify how any of the methods are implemented.
2915       *
2916       * <p>
2917       * The subclass must have a public constructor that takes in any of the following arguments:
2918       * <ul>
2919       *    <li>{@link RestChildren.Builder} - The builder for the object.
2920       *    <li>Any beans found in the specified bean store.
2921       *    <li>Any {@link Optional} beans that may or may not be found in the specified bean store.
2922       * </ul>
2923       *
2924       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
2925       * <p class='bjava'>
2926       *    <jc>// Our extended context class</jc>
2927       *    <jk>public</jk> MyRestChildren <jk>extends</jk> RestChildren {
2928       *       <jk>public</jk> MyRestChildren(RestChildren.Builder <jv>builder</jv>, ARequiredSpringBean <jv>bean1</jv>, Optional&lt;AnOptionalSpringBean&gt; <jv>bean2</jv>) {
2929       *          <jk>super</jk>(<jv>builder</jv>);
2930       *       }
2931       *
2932       *       <jc>// Override any methods.</jc>
2933       *
2934       *       <ja>@Override</ja>
2935       *       <jk>public</jk> Optional&lt;RestChildMatch&gt; findMatch(RestCall <jv>call</jv>) {
2936       *          String <jv>path</jv> = <jv>call</jv>.getPathInfo();
2937       *          <jk>if</jk> (<jv>path</jv>.endsWith(<js>"/foo"</js>)) {
2938       *             <jc>// Do our own special handling.</jc>
2939       *          }
2940       *          <jk>return super</jk>.findMatch(<jv>call</jv>);
2941       *       }
2942       *    }
2943       * </p>
2944       * <p class='bjava'>
2945       *    <jc>// Option #1 - Defined via annotation.</jc>
2946       *    <ja>@Rest</ja>(restChildrenClass=MyRestChildren.<jk>class</jk>)
2947       *    <jk>public class</jk> MyResource {
2948       *       ...
2949       *
2950       *       <jc>// Option #2 - Defined via builder passed in through init method.</jc>
2951       *       <ja>@RestInit</ja>
2952       *       <jk>public void</jk> init(RestContext.Builder <jv>builder</jv>) <jk>throws</jk> Exception {
2953       *          <jv>builder</jv>.restChildrenClass(MyRestChildren.<jk>class</jk>);
2954       *       }
2955       *    }
2956       * </p>
2957       *
2958       * @param value The new value for this setting.
2959       *    <br>Cannot be <jk>null</jk>.
2960       * @return This object.
2961       */
2962      public Builder restChildrenClass(Class<? extends RestChildren> value) {
2963         childrenClass = assertArgNotNull("value", value);
2964         return this;
2965      }
2966

2998      /**
2999       * REST operation context class.
3000       *
3001       * <p>
3002       * Allows you to extend the {@link RestOpContext} class to modify how any of the methods are implemented.
3003       *
3004       * <p>
3005       * The subclass must have a public constructor that takes in any of the following arguments:
3006       * <ul>
3007       *    <li>{@link RestOpContext.Builder} - The builder for the object.
3008       *    <li>Any beans found in the specified bean store.
3009       *    <li>Any {@link Optional} beans that may or may not be found in the specified bean store.
3010       * </ul>
3011       *
3012       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
3013       * <p class='bjava'>
3014       *    <jc>// Our extended context class that adds a request attribute to all requests.</jc>
3015       *    <jc>// The attribute value is provided by an injected spring bean.</jc>
3016       *    <jk>public</jk> MyRestOperationContext <jk>extends</jk> RestOpContext {
3017       *
3018       *       <jk>private final</jk> Optional&lt;? <jk>extends</jk> Supplier&lt;Object&gt;&gt; <jf>fooSupplier</jf>;
3019       *
3020       *       <jc>// Constructor that takes in builder and optional injected attribute provider.</jc>
3021       *       <jk>public</jk> MyRestOperationContext(RestOpContext.Builder <jv>builder</jv>, Optional&lt;AnInjectedFooSupplier&gt; <jv>fooSupplier</jv>) {
3022       *          <jk>super</jk>(<jv>builder</jv>);
3023       *          <jk>this</jk>.<jf>fooSupplier</jf> = <jv>fooSupplier</jv>.orElseGet(()-&gt;<jk>null</jk>);
3024       *       }
3025       *
3026       *       <jc>// Override the method used to create default request attributes.</jc>
3027       *       <ja>@Override</ja>
3028       *       <jk>protected</jk> NamedAttributeMap createDefaultRequestAttributes(Object <jv>resource</jv>, BeanStore <jv>beanStore</jv>, Method <jv>method</jv>, RestContext <jv>context</jv>) <jk>throws</jk> Exception {
3029       *          <jk>return super</jk>
3030       *             .createDefaultRequestAttributes(<jv>resource</jv>, <jv>beanStore</jv>, <jv>method</jv>, <jv>context</jv>)
3031       *             .append(NamedAttribute.<jsm>of</jsm>(<js>"foo"</js>, ()-&gt;<jf>fooSupplier</jf>.get());
3032       *       }
3033       *    }
3034       * </p>
3035       * <p class='bjava'>
3036       *    <jc>// Option #1 - Defined via annotation.</jc>
3037       *    <ja>@Rest</ja>(restOpContextClass=MyRestOperationContext.<jk>class</jk>)
3038       *    <jk>public class</jk> MyResource {
3039       *       ...
3040       *
3041       *       <jc>// Option #2 - Defined via builder passed in through init method.</jc>
3042       *       <ja>@RestInit</ja>
3043       *       <jk>public void</jk> init(RestContext.Builder <jv>builder</jv>) <jk>throws</jk> Exception {
3044       *          <jv>builder</jv>.methodContextClass(MyRestOperationContext.<jk>class</jk>);
3045       *       }
3046       *
3047       *       <ja>@RestGet</ja>
3048       *       <jk>public</jk> Object foo(RequestAttributes <jv>attributes</jv>) {
3049       *          <jk>return</jk> <jv>attributes</jv>.get(<js>"foo"</js>);
3050       *       }
3051       *    }
3052       * </p>
3053       *
3054       * @param value The new value for this setting.
3055       *    <br>Cannot be <jk>null</jk>.
3056       * @return This object.
3057       */
3058      public Builder restOpContextClass(Class<? extends RestOpContext> value) {
3059         opContextClass = assertArgNotNull("value", value);
3060         return this;
3061      }

3091       * <i><l>RestContext</l> configuration property:&emsp;</i>  Serializer listener.
3092       *
3093       * <p>
3094       * Specifies the serializer listener class to use for listening to non-fatal serialization errors.
3095       *
3096       * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
3097       *    <li class='jm'>{@link org.apache.juneau.serializer.Serializer.Builder#listener(Class)}
3098       * </ul>
3099       *
3100       * @param value The new value for this setting.
3101       *    <br>Cannot be <jk>null</jk>.
3102       * @return This object.
3103       */
3104      public Builder serializerListener(Class<? extends SerializerListener> value) {
3105         if (isNotVoid(assertArgNotNull("value", value)))
3106            serializers.forEach(x -> x.listener(value));
3107         return this;
3108      }

3110      /**
3111       * Returns the serializer group sub-builder.
3112       *
3113       * <p>
3114       * Serializers are used to convert POJOs to HTTP response bodies based on the {@code Accept} header.
3115       *
3116       * <p>
3117       * The default serializer set is empty.
3118       * It can be overridden via any of the following:
3119       * <ul class='spaced-list'>
3120       *    <li>Injected via bean store.
3121       *    <li>Class annotation: {@link Rest#serializers() @Rest(serializers)}
3122       *    <li>{@link RestInject @RestInject}-annotated method:
3123       *       <p class='bjava'>
3124       *    <ja>@RestInject</ja> <jk>public</jk> [<jk>static</jk>] SerializerSet myMethod(<i>&lt;args&gt;</i>) {...}
3125       *       </p>
3126       *       Args can be any injected bean including SerializerSet.Builder, the default builder.
3127       * </ul>
3128       *
3129       * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
3130       *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/Marshalling">Marshalling</a>
3131       * </ul>
3132       *
3133       * @return The serializer group sub-builder.
3134       */
3135      public SerializerSet.Builder serializers() {
3136         if (serializers == null)
3137            serializers = createSerializers(beanStore(), resource());
3138         return serializers;
3139      }

3201      /**
3202       * Returns the static files bean creator.
3203       *
3204       * <p>
3205       * Used to retrieve localized files to be served up as static files through the REST API via the following
3206       * predefined methods:
3207       * <ul class='javatree'>
3208       *    <li class='jm'>{@link BasicRestObject#getHtdoc(String, Locale)}.
3209       *    <li class='jm'>{@link BasicRestServlet#getHtdoc(String, Locale)}.
3210       * </ul>
3211       *
3212       * <p>
3213       * The static file finder can be accessed through the following methods:
3214       * <ul class='javatree'>
3215       *    <li class='jm'>{@link RestContext#getStaticFiles()}
3216       *    <li class='jm'>{@link RestRequest#getStaticFiles()}
3217       * </ul>
3218       *
3219       * <p>
3220       * The default static files finder implementation class is {@link BasicStaticFiles}.  This can be overridden via the following:
3221       * <ul class='spaced-list'>
3222       *    <li>
3223       *       The {@link Rest#staticFiles() @Rest(staticFiles)} annotation.
3224       *    <li>
3225       *       Overridden {@link StaticFiles} implementation class name specified in {@link #defaultClasses()}.
3226       *    <li>
3227       *       Type specified via <c>{@link RestContext.Builder}.{@link #staticFiles() staticFiles()}.{@link org.apache.juneau.rest.staticfile.StaticFiles.Builder#type(Class) type(Class)}</c>.
3228       *    <li>
3229       *       Bean specified via <c>{@link RestContext.Builder}.{@link #staticFiles() staticFiles()}.{@link org.apache.juneau.rest.staticfile.StaticFiles.Builder#impl(Object) impl(Object)}</c>.
3230       * </ul>
3231       *
3232       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
3233       * <p class='bjava'>
3234       *    <jc>// Create a static file finder that looks for files in the /files working subdirectory, but
3235       *    // overrides the find() and resolve methods for special handling of special cases and adds a
3236       * // Foo header to all requests.</jc>
3237       *    <jk>public class</jk> MyStaticFiles <jk>extends</jk> BasicStaticFiles {
3238       *
3239       *       <jk>public</jk> MyStaticFiles() {
3240       *          <jk>super</jk>(
3241       *             StaticFiles
3242       *                .<jsm>create</jsm>()
3243       *                .dir(<js>"/files"</js>)
3244       *                .headers(BasicStringHeader.<jsm>of</jsm>(<js>"Foo"</js>, <js>"bar"</js>))
3245       *          );
3246       *       }
3247       *    }
3248       * </p>
3249       * <p class='bjava'>
3250       *    <ja>@Rest</ja>(staticFiles=MyStaticFiles.<jk>class</jk>)
3251       *    <jk>public class</jk> MyResource {...}
3252       * </p>
3253       *
3254       * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
3255       *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/StaticFiles">Static files</a>
3256       * </ul>
3257       *
3258       * @return The static files bean creator.
3259       */
3260      public BeanCreator<StaticFiles> staticFiles() {
3261         if (staticFiles == null)
3262            staticFiles = createStaticFiles(beanStore, resource);
3263         return staticFiles;
3264      }
3265

3357      /**
3358       * Returns the thrown-store sub-builder.
3359       *
3360       * <p>
3361       * The thrown store is an in-memory cache of thrown exceptions.
3362       * It is used to store thrown exceptions when {@link MethodExecStats#error(Throwable)} is called from the {@link MethodExecStore}
3363       * bean of this resource.  It can also be accessed directly via {@link RestContext#getThrownStore()} or passed in as a parameter
3364       * on a {@link RestOp}-annotated method.
3365       *
3366       * <p>
3367       * The default thrown store is inherited from the parent context and can be overridden via any of the following:
3368       * <ul class='spaced-list'>
3369       *    <li>Injected via bean store.
3370       *    <li>{@link RestInject @RestInject}-annotated method:
3371       *       <p class='bjava'>
3372       *    <ja>@RestInject</ja> <jk>public</jk> [<jk>static</jk>] ThrownStore myMethod(<i>&lt;args&gt;</i>) {...}
3373       *       </p>
3374       *       Args can be any injected bean including ThrownStore.Builder, the default builder.
3375       * </ul>
3376       *
3377       * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
3378       *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/ExecutionStatistics">REST method execution statistics</a>
3379       * </ul>
3380       *
3381       * @return The builder for the {@link ThrownStore} object in the REST context.
3382       */
3383      public ThrownStore.Builder thrownStore() {
3384         if (thrownStore == null)
3385            thrownStore = createThrownStore(beanStore(), resource(), parentContext);
3386         return thrownStore;
3387      }
3388
3389      /**
3390       * Specifies the thrown store for this class.
3391       *
3392       * <p>
3393       * Equivalent to calling:
3394       * <p class='bjava'>
3395       *    <jv>builder</jv>.thrownStore().type(<jv>value</jv>);
3396       * </p>
3397       *
3398       * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
3399       *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/ExecutionStatistics">REST method execution statistics</a>
3400       *    <li class='jm'>{@link #thrownStore()}
3401       * </ul>
3402       *
3403       * @param value The new value.
3404       *    <br>Cannot be <jk>null</jk>.
3405       * @return This object.
3406       */
3407      public Builder thrownStore(Class<? extends ThrownStore> value) {
3408         thrownStore().type(assertArgNotNull("value", value));
3409         return this;
3410      }

3440
3441      /**
3442       * Resource authority path.
3443       *
3444       * <p>
3445       * Overrides the authority path value for this resource and any child resources.
3446       *
3447       * <p>
3448       * This setting is useful if you want to resolve relative URIs to absolute paths and want to explicitly specify the hostname/port.
3449       *
3450       * <p>
3451       * Affects the following methods:
3452       * <ul class='javatree'>
3453       *    <li class='jm'>{@link RestRequest#getAuthorityPath()}
3454       * </ul>
3455       *
3456       * <p>
3457       * If you do not specify the authority, it is automatically calculated via the following:
3458       *
3459       * <p class='bjava'>
3460       *    String <jv>scheme</jv> = <jv>request</jv>.getScheme();
3461       *    <jk>int</jk> <jv>port</jv> = <jv>request</jv>.getServerPort();
3462       *    StringBuilder <jv>sb</jv> = <jk>new</jk> StringBuilder(<jv>request</jv>.getScheme()).append(<js>"://"</js>).append(<jv>request</jv>.getServerName());
3463       *    <jk>if</jk> (! (<jv>port</jv> == 80 &amp;&amp; <js>"http"</js>.equals(<jv>scheme</jv>) || port == 443 &amp;&amp; <js>"https"</js>.equals(<jv>scheme</jv>)))
3464       *       <jv>sb</jv>.append(<js>':'</js>).append(<jv>port</jv>);
3465       *    <jv>authorityPath</jv> = <jv>sb</jv>.toString();
3466       * </p>
3467       *
3468       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
3469       * <p class='bjava'>
3470       *    <jc>// Option #1 - Defined via annotation resolving to a config file setting with default value.</jc>
3471       *    <ja>@Rest</ja>(
3472       *       path=<js>"/servlet"</js>,
3473       *       uriAuthority=<js>"$C{REST/authorityPathOverride,http://localhost:10000}"</js>
3474       *    )
3475       *    <jk>public class</jk> MyResource {
3476       *
3477       *       <jc>// Option #2 - Defined via builder passed in through resource constructor.</jc>
3478       *       <jk>public</jk> MyResource(RestContext.Builder <jv>builder</jv>) <jk>throws</jk> Exception {
3479       *
3480       *          <jc>// Using method on builder.</jc>
3481       *          <jv>builder</jv>.uriAuthority(<js>"http://localhost:10000"</js>);
3482       *       }
3483       *
3484       *       <jc>// Option #3 - Defined via builder passed in through init method.</jc>
3485       *       <ja>@RestInit</ja>
3486       *       <jk>public void</jk> init(RestContext.Builder <jv>builder</jv>) <jk>throws</jk> Exception {
3487       *          <jv>builder</jv>.uriAuthority(<js>"http://localhost:10000"</js>);
3488       *       }
3489       *    }
3490       * </p>
3491       *
3492       * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
3493       *    <li class='ja'>{@link Rest#uriAuthority}
3494       * </ul>
3495       *
3496       * @param value
3497       *    The new value for this setting.
3498       *    <br>The default is the first value found:
3499       *    <ul>
3500       *       <li>System property <js>"RestContext.uriAuthority"
3501       *       <li>Environment variable <js>"RESTCONTEXT_URIAUTHORITY"
3502       *       <li><jk>null</jk>
3503       *    </ul>
3504       *    <br>Cannot be <jk>null</jk>.
3505       * @return This object.
3506       */
3507      public Builder uriAuthority(String value) {
3508         uriAuthority = assertArgNotNull("value", value);
3509         return this;
3510      }
3511
3512      /**
3513       * Resource context path.
3514       *
3515       * <p>
3516       * Overrides the context path value for this resource and any child resources.
3517       *
3518       * <p>
3519       * This setting is useful if you want to use <js>"context:/child/path"</js> URLs in child resource POJOs but
3520       * the context path is not actually specified on the servlet container.
3521       *
3522       * <p>
3523       * Affects the following methods:
3524       * <ul class='javatree'>
3525       *    <li class='jm'>{@link RestRequest#getContextPath()} - Returns the overridden context path for the resource.
3526       *    <li class='jm'>{@link RestRequest#getServletPath()} - Includes the overridden context path for the resource.
3527       * </ul>
3528       *
3529       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
3530       * <p class='bjava'>
3531       *    <jc>// Option #1 - Defined via annotation resolving to a config file setting with default value.</jc>
3532       *    <ja>@Rest</ja>(
3533       *       path=<js>"/servlet"</js>,
3534       *       uriContext=<js>"$C{REST/contextPathOverride,/foo}"</js>
3535       *    )
3536       *    <jk>public class</jk> MyResource {
3537       *
3538       *       <jc>// Option #2 - Defined via builder passed in through resource constructor.</jc>
3539       *       <jk>public</jk> MyResource(RestContext.Builder <jv>builder</jv>) <jk>throws</jk> Exception {
3540       *
3541       *          <jc>// Using method on builder.</jc>
3542       *          <jv>builder</jv>.uriContext(<js>"/foo"</js>);
3543       *       }
3544       *
3545       *       <jc>// Option #3 - Defined via builder passed in through init method.</jc>
3546       *       <ja>@RestInit</ja>
3547       *       <jk>public void</jk> init(RestContext.Builder <jv>builder</jv>) <jk>throws</jk> Exception {
3548       *          <jv>builder</jv>.uriContext(<js>"/foo"</js>);
3549       *       }
3550       *    }
3551       * </p>
3552       *
3553       * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
3554       *    <li class='ja'>{@link Rest#uriContext}
3555       * </ul>
3556       *
3557       * @param value
3558       *    The new value for this setting.
3559       *    <br>The default is the first value found:
3560       *    <ul>
3561       *       <li>System property <js>"RestContext.uriContext"
3562       *       <li>Environment variable <js>"RESTCONTEXT_URICONTEXT"
3563       *       <li><jk>null</jk>
3564       *    </ul>
3565       *    <br>Cannot be <jk>null</jk>.
3566       * @return This object.
3567       */
3568      public Builder uriContext(String value) {
3569         uriContext = assertArgNotNull("value", value);
3570         return this;
3571      }

3574       * URI resolution relativity.
3575       *
3576       * <p>
3577       * Specifies how relative URIs should be interpreted by serializers.
3578       *
3579       * <p>
3580       * See {@link UriResolution} for possible values.
3581       *
3582       * <p>
3583       * Affects the following methods:
3584       * <ul class='javatree'>
3585       *    <li class='jm'>{@link RestRequest#getUriResolver()}

3589       * <p class='bjava'>

3591       *    <ja>@Rest</ja>(
3592       *       path=<js>"/servlet"</js>,
3593       *       uriRelativity=<js>"$C{REST/uriRelativity,PATH_INFO}"</js>
3594       *    )
3595       *    <jk>public class</jk> MyResource {
3596       *
3597       *       <jc>// Option #2 - Defined via builder passed in through resource constructor.</jc>
3598       *       <jk>public</jk> MyResource(RestContext.Builder <jv>builder</jv>) <jk>throws</jk> Exception {
3599       *
3600       *          <jc>// Using method on builder.</jc>
3601       *          <jv>builder</jv>.uriRelativity(<jsf>PATH_INFO</jsf>);
3602       *       }
3603       *
3604       *       <jc>// Option #3 - Defined via builder passed in through init method.</jc>
3605       *       <ja>@RestInit</ja>
3606       *       <jk>public void</jk> init(RestContext.Builder <jv>builder</jv>) <jk>throws</jk> Exception {
3607       *          <jv>builder</jv>.uriRelativity(<jsf>PATH_INFO</jsf>);
3608       *       }
3609       *    }
3610       * </p>
3611       *
3612       * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
3613       *    <li class='ja'>{@link Rest#uriRelativity}
3614       * </ul>
3615       *
3616       * @param value
3617       *    The new value for this setting.
3618       *    <br>The default is the first value found:
3619       *    <ul>
3620       *       <li>System property <js>"RestContext.uriRelativity"
3621       *       <li>Environment variable <js>"RESTCONTEXT_URIRELATIVITY"
3622       *       <li>{@link UriRelativity#RESOURCE}
3623       *    </ul>
3624       *    <br>Cannot be <jk>null</jk>.
3625       * @return This object.
3626       */
3627      public Builder uriRelativity(UriRelativity value) {
3628         uriRelativity = assertArgNotNull("value", value);
3629         return this;
3630      }

3691      /**
3692       * Returns the variable resolver sub-builder.
3693       *
3694       * <p>
3695       *    The variable resolver is used to resolve string variables of the form <js>"$X{...}"</js> in various places such as annotations on the REST class and methods.
3696       *
3697       * <p>
3698       *    Can be used to add more variables or context objects to the variable resolver.
3699       *    These variables affect the variable resolver returned by {@link RestRequest#getVarResolverSession()}.
3700       *
3701       * <p>
3702       * The var resolver is created by the constructor using the {@link #createVarResolver(BeanStore,Supplier,Class)} method and is initialized with the following variables:
3703       * <ul class='javatreec'>
3704       *    <li class='jc'>{@link ArgsVar}
3705       *    <li class='jc'>{@link CoalesceVar}
3706       *    <li class='jc'>{@link ConfigVar}
3707       *    <li class='jc'>{@link EnvVariablesVar}
3708       *    <li class='jc'>{@link FileVar}
3709       *    <li class='jc'>{@link HtmlWidgetVar}
3710       *    <li class='jc'>{@link IfVar}
3711       *    <li class='jc'>{@link LenVar}
3712       *    <li class='jc'>{@link LocalizationVar}
3713       *    <li class='jc'>{@link LowerCaseVar}
3714       *    <li class='jc'>{@link ManifestFileVar}
3715       *    <li class='jc'>{@link NotEmptyVar}
3716       *    <li class='jc'>{@link PatternExtractVar}
3717       *    <li class='jc'>{@link PatternMatchVar}
3718       *    <li class='jc'>{@link PatternReplaceVar}
3719       *    <li class='jc'>{@link RequestAttributeVar}
3720       *    <li class='jc'>{@link RequestFormDataVar}
3721       *    <li class='jc'>{@link RequestHeaderVar}
3722       *    <li class='jc'>{@link RequestPathVar}
3723       *    <li class='jc'>{@link RequestQueryVar}
3724       *    <li class='jc'>{@link RequestSwaggerVar}
3725       *    <li class='jc'>{@link RequestVar}
3726       *    <li class='jc'>{@link SerializedRequestAttrVar}
3727       *    <li class='jc'>{@link ServletInitParamVar}
3728       *    <li class='jc'>{@link SubstringVar}
3729       *    <li class='jc'>{@link SwaggerVar}
3730       *    <li class='jc'>{@link SwitchVar}
3731       *    <li class='jc'>{@link SystemPropertiesVar}
3732       *    <li class='jc'>{@link UpperCaseVar}
3733       *    <li class='jc'>{@link UrlEncodeVar}
3734       *    <li class='jc'>{@link UrlVar}
3735       * </ul>
3736       *
3737       * <p>
3738       * The default var resolver can be overridden via any of the following:
3739       * <ul class='spaced-list'>
3740       *    <li>Injected via bean store.
3741       *    <li>{@link RestInject @RestInject}-annotated methods:
3742       *       <p class='bjava'>
3743       *    <ja>@RestInject</ja> <jk>public</jk> [<jk>static</jk>] VarResolver myMethod(<i>&lt;args&gt;</i>) {...}
3744       *       </p>
3745       *       Args can be any injected bean including {@link org.apache.juneau.svl.VarResolver.Builder}, the default builder.
3746       * </ul>
3747       *
3748       * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
3749       *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/RestServerSvlVariables">SVL Variables</a>
3750       * </ul>
3751       *
3752       * @return The variable resolver sub-builder.
3753       */
3754      public VarResolver.Builder varResolver() {
3755         return varResolver;
3756      }
3757
3758      /**
3759       * Adds one or more variables to the var resolver of this class.
3760       *
3761       * <p>
3762       * Equivalent to calling:
3763       * <p class='bjava'>
3764       *    <jv>builder</jv>.vars().add(<jv>value</jv>);
3765       * </p>
3766       *
3767       * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
3768       *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/RestServerSvlVariables">SVL Variables</a>
3769       *    <li class='jm'>{@link #varResolver()}
3770       * </ul>
3771       *
3772       * @param value The values to add.
3773       *    <br>Cannot contain <jk>null</jk> values.
3774       * @return This object.
3775       */
3776      @SafeVarargs
3777      public final Builder vars(Class<? extends Var>...value) {
3778         assertArgNoNulls("value", value);
3779         varResolver.vars(value);
3780         return this;
3781      }
3782
3783      /**
3784       * Adds one or more variables to the var resolver of this class.
3785       *
3786       * <p>
3787       * Equivalent to calling:
3788       * <p class='bjava'>
3789       *    <jv>builder</jv>.vars().add(<jv>value</jv>);
3790       * </p>
3791       *
3792       * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
3793       *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/RestServerSvlVariables">SVL Variables</a>
3794       *    <li class='jm'>{@link #varResolver()}
3795       * </ul>
3796       *
3797       * @param value The values to add.
3798       *    <br>Cannot contain <jk>null</jk> values.
3799       * @return This object.
3800       */
3801      public Builder vars(Var...value) {
3802         assertArgNoNulls("value", value);
3803         varResolver.vars(value);
3804         return this;
3805      }
3806
3807      private static void runInitHooks(BeanStore beanStore, Supplier<?> resource) throws ServletException {
3808
3809         var r = resource.get();
3810
3811         var map = CollectionUtils.<String,MethodInfo>map();
3812         // @formatter:off
3813         ClassInfo.ofProxy(r).getAllMethodsTopDown().stream()
3814            .filter(y -> y.hasAnnotation(RestInit.class) && ! y.hasParameter(RestOpContext.Builder.class))
3815            .forEach(y -> {
3816               var sig = y.getSignature();
3817               if (! map.containsKey(sig))
3818                  map.put(sig, y.accessible());
3819            }
3820         );
3821         // @formatter:on
3822
3823         for (var m : map.values()) {
3824            if (! beanStore.hasAllParams(m))
3825               throw servletException("Could not call @RestInit method {0}.{1}.  Could not find prerequisites: {2}.", cns(m.getDeclaringClass()), m.getSignature(), beanStore.getMissingParams(m));
3826            try {
3827               m.invoke(r, beanStore.getParams(m));
3828            } catch (Exception e) {
3829               throw servletException(e, "Exception thrown from @RestInit method {0}.{1}.", cns(m.getDeclaringClass()), m.getSignature());
3830            }
3831         }
3832      }
3833
3834      /**
3835       * Instantiates the bean context sub-builder.
3836       *
3837       * @param beanStore
3838       *    The factory used for creating beans and retrieving injected beans.
3839       * @param resource
3840       *    The REST servlet/bean instance that this context is defined against.
3841       * @return A new bean context sub-builder.
3842       */
3843      protected BeanContext.Builder createBeanContext(BeanStore beanStore, Supplier<?> resource) {
3844
3845         // Default value.
3846         Value<BeanContext.Builder> v = Value.of(BeanContext.create());
3847
3848         // Replace with builder from bean store.
3849         // @formatter:off
3850         beanStore
3851            .getBean(BeanContext.Builder.class)
3852            .map(BeanContext.Builder::copy)
3853            .ifPresent(x -> v.set(x));
3854         // @formatter:on
3855
3856         // Replace with bean from bean store.
3857         beanStore.getBean(BeanContext.class).ifPresent(x -> v.get().impl(x));
3858
3859         return v.get();
3860      }
3861
3862      /**
3863       * Creates the bean store in this builder.
3864       *
3865       * @param resource
3866       *    The REST servlet/bean instance that this context is defined against.
3867       * @return A new bean store builder.
3868       */
3869      protected BeanStore.Builder createBeanStore(Supplier<?> resource) {
3870
3871         // Default value.
3872         // @formatter:off
3873         var v = Value.of(
3874            BeanStore
3875               .create()
3876               .parent(rootBeanStore())
3877               .outer(resource.get())
3878            );
3879         // @formatter:on
3880
3881         // Apply @Rest(beanStore).
3882         rstream(AP.find(Rest.class, info(resourceClass))).map(x -> x.inner().beanStore()).filter(ClassUtils::isNotVoid).forEach(x -> v.get().type(x));
3883
3884         // Replace with bean from:  @RestInject public [static] BeanStore xxx(<args>)
3885         // @formatter:off
3886         v.get().build()
3887            .createMethodFinder(BeanStore.class)
3888            .find(Builder::isRestBeanMethod)
3889            .run(x -> v.get().impl(x));
3890         // @formatter:on
3891
3892         return v.get();
3893      }
3894
3895      /**
3896       * Instantiates the call logger sub-builder.
3897       *
3898       * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
3899       *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/RestServerLoggingAndDebugging">Logging / Debugging</a>
3900       * </ul>
3901       *
3902       * @param beanStore
3903       *    The factory used for creating beans and retrieving injected beans.
3904       * @param resource
3905       *    The REST servlet/bean instance that this context is defined against.
3906       * @return A new call logger sub-builder.
3907       */
3908      protected BeanCreator<CallLogger> createCallLogger(BeanStore beanStore, Supplier<?> resource) {
3909
3910         var creator = beanStore.createBean(CallLogger.class).type(BasicCallLogger.class);
3911
3912         // Specify the bean type if its set as a default.
3913         defaultClasses().get(CallLogger.class).ifPresent(x -> creator.type(x));
3914
3915         beanStore.getBean(CallLogger.class).ifPresent(x -> creator.impl(x));
3916
3917         // Replace with bean from:  @RestInject public [static] CallLogger xxx(<args>)
3918         beanStore.createMethodFinder(CallLogger.class).find(Builder::isRestBeanMethod).run(x -> creator.impl(x));
3919
3920         return creator;
3921      }
3922
3923      /**
3924       * Creates the config for this builder.
3925       *
3926       * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
3927       *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/ConfigurationFiles">Configuration Files</a>
3928       *    <li class='jm'>{@link #config()}
3929       * </ul>
3930       *
3931       * @param beanStore
3932       *    The factory used for creating beans and retrieving injected beans.
3933       * @param resource
3934       *    The REST servlet/bean instance that this context is defined against.
3935       * @param resourceClass
3936       *    The REST servlet/bean type that this context is defined against.
3937       * @return A new config.
3938       */
3939      protected Config createConfig(BeanStore beanStore, Supplier<?> resource, Class<?> resourceClass) {
3940
3941         var v = Value.<Config>empty();
3942
3943         // Find our config file.  It's the last non-empty @RestResource(config).
3944         var vr = beanStore.getBean(VarResolver.class).orElseThrow(() -> new IllegalArgumentException("VarResolver not found."));
3945         var cfv = Value.<String>empty();
3946         rstream(AP.find(Rest.class, info(resourceClass))).map(x -> x.inner().config()).filter(Utils::ne).forEach(x -> cfv.set(vr.resolve(x)));
3947         var cf = cfv.orElse("");
3948
3949         // If not specified or value is set to SYSTEM_DEFAULT, use system default config.
3950         if (v.isEmpty() && "SYSTEM_DEFAULT".equals(cf))
3951            v.set(Config.getSystemDefault());
3952
3953         // Otherwise build one.
3954         if (v.isEmpty()) {
3955            Config.Builder cb = Config.create().varResolver(vr);
3956            if (! cf.isEmpty())
3957               cb.name(cf);
3958            v.set(cb.build());
3959         }
3960
3961         // Replace with bean from bean store.
3962         beanStore.getBean(Config.class).ifPresent(x -> v.set(x));
3963
3964         // Replace with bean from:  @RestInject public [static] Config xxx(<args>)
3965         beanStore.createMethodFinder(Config.class).addBean(Config.class, v.get()).find(Builder::isRestBeanMethod).run(x -> v.set(x));
3966
3967         return v.get();
3968      }
3969
3970      /**
3971       * Instantiates the debug enablement bean creator.
3972       *
3973       * @param beanStore
3974       *    The factory used for creating beans and retrieving injected beans.
3975       * @param resource
3976       *    The REST servlet/bean instance that this context is defined against.
3977       * @return A new debug enablement bean creator.
3978       */
3979      protected BeanCreator<DebugEnablement> createDebugEnablement(BeanStore beanStore, Supplier<?> resource) {
3980
3981         var creator = beanStore.createBean(DebugEnablement.class).type(BasicDebugEnablement.class);
3982
3983         // Specify the bean type if its set as a default.
3984         defaultClasses().get(DebugEnablement.class).ifPresent(x -> creator.type(x));
3985
3986         beanStore.getBean(DebugEnablement.class).ifPresent(x -> creator.impl(x));
3987
3988         // Replace with bean from:  @RestInject public [static] DebugEnablement xxx(<args>)
3989         beanStore.createMethodFinder(DebugEnablement.class).find(Builder::isRestBeanMethod).run(x -> creator.impl(x));
3990
3991         return creator;
3992      }

4481       * @param beanStore
4482       *    The factory used for creating beans and retrieving injected beans.
4483       * @param resource
4484       *    The REST servlet/bean instance that this context is defined against.
4485       * @return A new REST children list.
4486       * @throws Exception If a problem occurred instantiating one of the child rest contexts.
4487       */
4488      protected RestChildren.Builder createRestChildren(BeanStore beanStore, Supplier<?> resource, RestContext restContext) throws Exception {
4489
4490         // Default value.
4491         Value<RestChildren.Builder> v = Value.of(RestChildren.create(beanStore).type(childrenClass));
4492
4493         // Initialize our child resources.
4494         for (var o : children) {
4495            var path = (String)null;
4496            Supplier<?> so;
4497
4498            if (o instanceof RestChild o2) {
4499               path = o2.path;
4500               var o3 = o2.resource;
4501               so = () -> o3;
4502            }
4503
4504            var cb = (Builder)null;
4505
4506            if (o instanceof Class<?> oc) {
4507               // Don't allow specifying yourself as a child.  Causes an infinite loop.
4508               if (oc == resourceClass)
4509                  continue;
4510               cb = RestContext.create(oc, restContext, inner);
4511               if (beanStore.getBean(oc).isPresent()) {
4512                  so = () -> beanStore.getBean(oc).get();  // If we resolved via injection, always get it this way.
4513               } else {
4514                  Object o2 = beanStore.createBean(oc).builder(RestContext.Builder.class, cb).run();
4515                  so = () -> o2;
4516               }
4517            } else {
4518               cb = RestContext.create(o.getClass(), restContext, inner);
4519               so = () -> o;
4520            }
4521
4522            if (nn(path))
4523               cb.path(path);
4524
4525            var cc = cb.init(so).build();
4526
4527            var mi = ClassInfo.of(so.get()).getMethod(x -> x.hasName("setContext") && x.hasParameterTypes(RestContext.class)).orElse(null);
4528            if (nn(mi))
4529               mi.accessible().invoke(so.get(), cc);
4530
4531            v.get().add(cc);
4532         }
4533
4534         // Replace with bean from:  @RestInject public [static] RestChildren xxx(<args>)
4535         beanStore.createMethodFinder(RestChildren.class).addBean(RestChildren.Builder.class, v.get()).find(Builder::isRestBeanMethod).run(x -> v.get().impl(x));
4536
4537         return v.get();
4538      }
4539
4540      /**
4541       * Instantiates the REST operation args sub-builder.
4542       *
4543       * <p>
4544       * Instantiates based on the following logic:
4545       * <ul>
4546       *    <li>Looks for REST op args set via any of the following:
4547       *       <ul>
4548       *          <li>{@link RestContext.Builder#restOpArgs(Class...)}/{@link RestContext.Builder#restOpArgs(Class...)}
4549       *          <li>{@link Rest#restOpArgs()}.
4550       *       </ul>
4551       *    <li>Looks for a static or non-static <c>createRestParams()</c> method that returns <c>{@link Class}[]</c>.
4552       *    <li>Resolves it via the bean store registered in this context.
4553       *    <li>Instantiates a default set of parameters.
4554       * </ul>
4555       *
4556       * @param beanStore
4557       *    The factory used for creating beans and retrieving injected beans.
4558       * @param resource
4559       *    The REST servlet/bean instance that this context is defined against.
4560       * @return A new REST operation args sub-builder.
4561       */
4562      protected RestOpArgList.Builder createRestOpArgs(BeanStore beanStore, Supplier<?> resource) {
4563
4564         // Default value.
4565         Value<RestOpArgList.Builder> v = Value.of(RestOpArgList.create(beanStore).add(AttributeArg.class, ContentArg.class, FormDataArg.class, HasFormDataArg.class, HasQueryArg.class,
4566            HeaderArg.class, HttpServletRequestArgs.class, HttpServletResponseArgs.class, HttpSessionArgs.class, InputStreamParserArg.class, MethodArg.class, ParserArg.class, PathArg.class,
4567            PathRemainderArg.class, QueryArg.class, ReaderParserArg.class, RequestBeanArg.class, ResponseBeanArg.class, ResponseHeaderArg.class, ResponseCodeArg.class, RestContextArgs.class,
4568            RestSessionArgs.class, RestOpContextArgs.class, RestOpSessionArgs.class, RestRequestArgs.class, RestResponseArgs.class, DefaultArg.class));
4569
4570         // Replace with bean from bean store.
4571         beanStore.getBean(RestOpArgList.class).ifPresent(x -> v.get().impl(x));
4572
4573         // Replace with bean from:  @RestInject public [static] RestOpArgList xxx(<args>)
4574         beanStore.createMethodFinder(RestOpArgList.class).addBean(RestOpArgList.Builder.class, v.get()).find(Builder::isRestBeanMethod).run(x -> v.get().impl(x));
4575
4576         return v.get();
4577      }
4578
4579      /**
4580       * Instantiates the REST operations list.
4581       *
4582       * <p>
4583       * The set of {@link RestOpContext} objects that represent the methods on this resource.
4584       *
4585       * @param restContext The rest context.
4586       * @param beanStore
4587       *    The factory used for creating beans and retrieving injected beans.
4588       * @param resource
4589       *    The REST servlet/bean instance that this context is defined against.
4590       * @return A new REST operations list.
4591       * @throws ServletException If a problem occurred instantiating one of the child rest contexts.
4592       */
4593      protected RestOperations.Builder createRestOperations(BeanStore beanStore, Supplier<?> resource, RestContext restContext) throws ServletException {
4594
4595         // Default value.
4596         Value<RestOperations.Builder> v = Value.of(RestOperations.create(beanStore));
4597         var ap = restContext.getBeanContext().getAnnotationProvider();
4598
4599         var rci = ClassInfo.of(resource.get());
4600
4601         var initMap = CollectionUtils.<String,MethodInfo>map();
4602         // @formatter:off
4603         ClassInfo.ofProxy(resource.get()).getAllMethodsTopDown().stream()
4604            .filter(y -> y.hasAnnotation(RestInit.class) && y.hasParameter(RestOpContext.Builder.class))
4605            .forEach(y -> {
4606               var sig = y.getSignature();
4607               if (! initMap.containsKey(sig))
4608                  initMap.put(sig, y.accessible());
4609            });
4610         // @formatter:on
4611
4612         for (var mi : rci.getPublicMethods()) {
4613            var al = rstream(ap.find(mi)).filter(REST_OP_GROUP).collect(Collectors.toList());
4614
4615            // Also include methods on @Rest-annotated interfaces.
4616            if (al.isEmpty()) {
4617               Predicate<MethodInfo> isRestAnnotatedInterface = x -> x.getDeclaringClass().isInterface()
4618                  && nn(x.getDeclaringClass().getAnnotations(Rest.class).findFirst().map(AnnotationInfo::inner).orElse(null));
4619               mi.getMatchingMethods().stream().filter(isRestAnnotatedInterface).forEach(x -> al.add(AnnotationInfo.of(x, RestOpAnnotation.DEFAULT)));
4620            }
4621
4622            if (al.size() > 0) {
4623               try {
4624                  if (mi.isNotPublic())
4625                     throw servletException("@RestOp method {0}.{1} must be defined as public.", rci.inner().getName(), mi.getSimpleName());
4626
4627                  RestOpContext.Builder rocb = RestOpContext.create(mi.inner(), restContext).beanStore(beanStore).type(opContextClass);
4628
4629                  beanStore = BeanStore.of(beanStore, resource.get()).addBean(RestOpContext.Builder.class, rocb);
4630                  for (var m : initMap.values()) {
4631                     if (! beanStore.hasAllParams(m)) {
4632                        throw servletException("Could not call @RestInit method {0}.{1}.  Could not find prerequisites: {2}.", cns(m.getDeclaringClass()), m.getSignature(),
4633                           beanStore.getMissingParams(m));
4634                     }
4635                     try {
4636                        m.invoke(resource.get(), beanStore.getParams(m));
4637                     } catch (Exception e) {
4638                        throw servletException(e, "Exception thrown from @RestInit method {0}.{1}.", cns(m.getDeclaringClass()), m.getSignature());
4639                     }
4640                  }
4641
4642                  var roc = rocb.build();
4643
4644                  String httpMethod = roc.getHttpMethod();
4645
4646                  // RRPC is a special case where a method returns an interface that we
4647                  // can perform REST calls against.
4648                  // We override the CallMethod.invoke() method to insert our logic.
4649                  if ("RRPC".equals(httpMethod)) {
4650
4651                     // @formatter:off
4652                     RestOpContext roc2 = RestOpContext
4653                        .create(mi.inner(), restContext)
4654                        .dotAll()
4655                        .beanStore(restContext.getRootBeanStore())
4656                        .type(RrpcRestOpContext.class)
4657                        .build();
4658                     v.get()
4659                        .add("GET", roc2)
4660                        .add("POST", roc2);
4661                     // @formatter:on
4662
4663                  } else {
4664                     v.get().add(roc);
4665                  }
4666               } catch (Throwable e) {
4667                  throw servletException(e, "Problem occurred trying to initialize methods on class {0}", rci.inner().getName());
4668               }
4669            }
4670         }
4671
4672         // Replace with bean from:  @RestInject public [static] RestOperations xxx(<args>)
4673         beanStore.createMethodFinder(RestOperations.class).addBean(RestOperations.Builder.class, v.get()).find(Builder::isRestBeanMethod).run(x -> v.get().impl(x));
4674
4675         return v.get();
4676      }
4677
4678      /**
4679       * Instantiates the serializer group sub-builder.
4680       *
4681       * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
4682       *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/Marshalling">Marshalling</a>
4683       * </ul>
4684       *
4685       * @param resource
4686       *    The REST servlet/bean instance that this context is defined against.
4687       * @param beanStore
4688       *    The factory used for creating beans and retrieving injected beans.
4689       *    <br>Created by {@link RestContext.Builder#beanStore()}.
4690       * @return A new serializer group sub-builder.
4691       */
4692      protected SerializerSet.Builder createSerializers(BeanStore beanStore, Supplier<?> resource) {
4693
4694         // Default value.
4695         Value<SerializerSet.Builder> v = Value.of(SerializerSet.create(beanStore));
4696
4697         // Specify the implementation class if its set as a default.
4698         defaultClasses().get(SerializerSet.class).ifPresent(x -> v.get().type(x));
4699
4700         // Replace with bean from bean store.
4701         beanStore.getBean(SerializerSet.class).ifPresent(x -> v.get().impl(x));
4702
4703         // Replace with bean from:  @RestInject public [static] SerializerSet xxx(<args>)
4704         beanStore.createMethodFinder(SerializerSet.class).addBean(SerializerSet.Builder.class, v.get()).find(Builder::isRestBeanMethod).run(x -> v.get().impl(x));
4705
4706         return v.get();
4707      }

4709      /**
4710       * Instantiates the start call method list.
4711       *
4712       * @param beanStore
4713       *    The factory used for creating beans and retrieving injected beans.
4714       * @param resource
4715       *    The REST servlet/bean instance that this context is defined against.
4716       * @return A new start call method list.
4717       */
4718      protected MethodList createStartCallMethods(BeanStore beanStore, Supplier<?> resource) {
4719
4720         // Default value.
4721         Value<MethodList> v = Value.of(getAnnotatedMethods(resource, RestStartCall.class, x -> true));
4722
4723         // Replace with bean from:  @RestInject(name="startCallMethods") public [static] MethodList xxx(<args>)
4724         beanStore.createMethodFinder(MethodList.class).addBean(MethodList.class, v.get()).find(x -> isRestBeanMethod(x, "startCallMethods")).run(x -> v.set(x));
4725
4726         return v.get();
4727      }
