4730       * Instantiates the static files bean creator.
4731       *
4732       * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
4733       *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/StaticFiles">Static files</a>
4734       * </ul>
4735       *
4736       * @param beanStore
4737       *    The factory used for creating beans and retrieving injected beans.
4738       * @param resource
4739       *    The REST servlet/bean instance that this context is defined against.
4740       * @return A new static files sub-builder.
4741       */
4742      protected BeanCreator<StaticFiles> createStaticFiles(BeanStore beanStore, Supplier<?> resource) {
4743
4744         var creator = beanStore.createBean(StaticFiles.class).type(BasicStaticFiles.class);
4745
4746         // Specify the bean type if its set as a default.
4747         defaultClasses().get(StaticFiles.class).ifPresent(x -> creator.type(x));
4748
4749         beanStore.getBean(StaticFiles.class).ifPresent(x -> creator.impl(x));
4750
4751         // Replace with bean from:  @RestInject public [static] StaticFiles xxx(<args>)
4752         beanStore.createMethodFinder(StaticFiles.class).find(Builder::isRestBeanMethod).run(x -> creator.impl(x));
4753
4754         return creator;
4755      }
4756
4757      /**
4758       * Instantiates the swagger provider sub-builder.
4759       *
4760       * <p>
4761       * Instantiates based on the following logic:
4762       * <ul>
4763       *    <li>Returns the resource class itself is an instance of {@link SwaggerProvider}.
4764       *    <li>Looks for swagger provider set via any of the following:
4765       *       <ul>
4766       *          <li>{@link RestContext.Builder#swaggerProvider(Class)}/{@link RestContext.Builder#swaggerProvider(SwaggerProvider)}
4767       *          <li>{@link Rest#swaggerProvider()}.
4768       *       </ul>
4769       *    <li>Looks for a static or non-static <c>createSwaggerProvider()</c> method that returns {@link SwaggerProvider} on the
4770       *       resource class with any of the following arguments:
4771       *       <ul>
4772       *          <li>{@link RestContext}
4773       *          <li>{@link BeanStore}
4774       *          <li>Any <a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/JuneauRestServerSpringbootBasics">juneau-rest-server-springboot Basics</a>.
4775       *       </ul>
4776       *    <li>Resolves it via the bean store registered in this context.
4777       *    <li>Instantiates a default {@link BasicSwaggerProvider}.
4778       * </ul>
4779       *
4780       * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
4781       *    <li class='jm'>{@link RestContext.Builder#swaggerProvider(Class)}
4782       *    <li class='jm'>{@link RestContext.Builder#swaggerProvider(SwaggerProvider)}
4783       * </ul>
4784       *
4785       * @param beanStore
4786       *    The factory used for creating beans and retrieving injected beans.
4787       * @param resource
4788       *    The REST servlet/bean instance that this context is defined against.
4789       * @return A new swagger provider sub-builder.
4790       */
4791      protected BeanCreator<SwaggerProvider> createSwaggerProvider(BeanStore beanStore, Supplier<?> resource) {
4792
4793         var creator = beanStore.createBean(SwaggerProvider.class).type(BasicSwaggerProvider.class);
4794
4795         // Specify the bean type if its set as a default.
4796         defaultClasses().get(SwaggerProvider.class).ifPresent(x -> creator.type(x));
4797
4798         beanStore.getBean(SwaggerProvider.class).ifPresent(x -> creator.impl(x));
4799
4800         // Replace with bean from:  @RestInject public [static] SwaggerProvider xxx(<args>)
4801         beanStore.createMethodFinder(SwaggerProvider.class).find(Builder::isRestBeanMethod).run(x -> creator.impl(x));
4802
4803         return creator;
4804      }

4806      /**
4807       * Instantiates the thrown-store sub-builder.
4808       *
4809       * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
4810       *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/ExecutionStatistics">REST method execution statistics</a>
4811       * </ul>
4812       *
4813       * @param resource
4814       *    The REST servlet/bean instance that this context is defined against.
4815       * @param parent
4816       *    The parent context if the REST bean was registered via {@link Rest#children()}.
4817       *    <br>Will be <jk>null</jk> if the bean is a top-level resource.
4818       * @param beanStore
4819       *    The factory used for creating beans and retrieving injected beans.
4820       *    <br>Created by {@link RestContext.Builder#beanStore()}.
4821       * @return A new thrown-store sub-builder.
4822       */
4823      protected ThrownStore.Builder createThrownStore(BeanStore beanStore, Supplier<?> resource, RestContext parent) {
4824
4825         // Default value.
4826         Value<ThrownStore.Builder> v = Value.of(ThrownStore.create(beanStore).impl(parent == null ? null : parent.getThrownStore()));
4827
4828         // Specify the implementation class if its set as a default.
4829         defaultClasses().get(ThrownStore.class).ifPresent(x -> v.get().type(x));
4830
4831         // Replace with bean from bean store.
4832         beanStore.getBean(ThrownStore.class).ifPresent(x -> v.get().impl(x));
4833
4834         // Replace with bean from:  @RestInject public [static] ThrownStore xxx(<args>)
4835         beanStore.createMethodFinder(ThrownStore.class).addBean(ThrownStore.Builder.class, v.get()).find(Builder::isRestBeanMethod).run(x -> v.get().impl(x));
4836
4837         return v.get();
4838      }

4840      /**
4841       * Creates the variable resolver sub-builder.
4842       *
4843       * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
4844       *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/RestServerSvlVariables">SVL Variables</a>
4845       * </ul>
4846       *
4847       * @param beanStore
4848       *    The factory used for creating beans and retrieving injected beans.
4849       * @param resource
4850       *    The REST servlet/bean instance that this context is defined against.
4851       * @param resourceClass
4852       *    The REST servlet/bean type that this context is defined against.
4853       * @return A new variable resolver sub-builder.
4854       */
4855      protected VarResolver.Builder createVarResolver(BeanStore beanStore, Supplier<?> resource, Class<?> resourceClass) {
4856
4857         // Default value.
4858         // @formatter:off
4859         Value<VarResolver.Builder> v = Value.of(
4860            VarResolver
4861               .create()
4862               .defaultVars()
4863               .vars(
4864                  VarList.of(
4865                     ConfigVar.class,
4866                     FileVar.class,
4867                     LocalizationVar.class,
4868                     RequestAttributeVar.class,
4869                     RequestFormDataVar.class,
4870                     RequestHeaderVar.class,
4871                     RequestPathVar.class,
4872                     RequestQueryVar.class,
4873                     RequestVar.class,
4874                     RequestSwaggerVar.class,
4875                     SerializedRequestAttrVar.class,
4876                     ServletInitParamVar.class,
4877                     SwaggerVar.class,
4878                     UrlVar.class,
4879                     UrlEncodeVar.class,
4880                     HtmlWidgetVar.class
4881                  )
4882                  .addDefault()
4883               )
4884               .bean(FileFinder.class, FileFinder.create(beanStore).cp(resourceClass,null,true).build())
4885         );
4886         // @formatter:on
4887
4888         // Replace with bean from bean store.
4889         beanStore.getBean(VarResolver.class).ifPresent(x -> v.get().impl(x));
4890
4891         // Replace with bean from:  @RestInject public [static] VarResolver xxx(<args>)
4892         beanStore.createMethodFinder(VarResolver.class).addBean(VarResolver.Builder.class, v.get()).find(Builder::isRestBeanMethod).run(x -> v.get().impl(x));
4893
4894         return v.get();
4895      }

4898   private static final Map<Class<?>,RestContext> REGISTRY = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();

4900   /**
4901    * Creates a new builder for this object.
4902    *
4903    * @param resourceClass
4904    *    The class annotated with <ja>@Rest</ja>.
4905    *    <br>Must not be <jk>null</jk>.
4906    * @param parentContext
4907    *    The parent context if the REST bean was registered via {@link Rest#children()}.
4908    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk> if the bean is a top-level resource.
4909    * @param servletConfig
4910    *    The servlet config passed into the servlet by the servlet container.
4911    *    <br>Can be <jk>null</jk> if not available.
4912    *    <br>If <jk>null</jk>, then some features (such as access to servlet init params) will not be available.
4913    *
4914    * @return A new builder object.
4915    * @throws ServletException Something bad happened.
4916    */
4917   public static Builder create(Class<?> resourceClass, RestContext parentContext, ServletConfig servletConfig) throws ServletException {
4918      return new Builder(resourceClass, parentContext, servletConfig);
4919   }

4922    * Returns a registry of all created {@link RestContext} objects.
4923    *
4924    * @return An unmodifiable map of resource classes to {@link RestContext} objects.
4925    */
4926   public static final Map<Class<?>,RestContext> getGlobalRegistry() { return u(REGISTRY); }

4928   static ServletException servletException(String msg, Object...args) {
4929      return new ServletException(f(msg, args));
4930   }
4931
4932   static ServletException servletException(Throwable t, String msg, Object...args) {
4933      return new ServletException(f(msg, args), t);
4934   }

4998   /**
4999    * Constructor.
5000    *
5001    * @param builder The builder containing the settings for this bean.
5002    * @throws Exception If any initialization problems were encountered.
5003    */
5004   public RestContext(Builder builder) throws Exception {
5005      super(builder);
5006
5007      startTime = Instant.now();
5008
5009      REGISTRY.put(builder.resourceClass, this);
5010
5011      BasicHttpException _initException = null;
5012
5013      try {
5014         this.builder = builder;
5015
5016         defaultClasses = builder.defaultClasses();
5017         defaultSettings = builder.defaultSettings();
5018         parentContext = builder.parentContext;
5019         resource = builder.resource;
5020         resourceClass = builder.resourceClass;
5021         rootBeanStore = builder.rootBeanStore();
5022
5023         BeanStore bs = beanStore = builder.beanStore();
5024         // @formatter:off
5025         beanStore
5026            .addBean(BeanStore.class, beanStore)
5027            .addBean(RestContext.class, this)
5028            .addBean(Object.class, resource.get())
5029            .addBean(DefaultSettingsMap.class, defaultSettings)
5030            .addBean(Builder.class, builder)
5031            .addBean(AnnotationWorkList.class, builder.getApplied());
5032         // @formatter:on
5033
5034         path = nn(builder.path) ? builder.path : "";
5035         fullPath = (parentContext == null ? "" : (parentContext.fullPath + '/')) + path;
5036         var p = path;
5037         if (! p.endsWith("/*"))
5038            p += "/*";
5039         pathMatcher = UrlPathMatcher.of(p);
5040
5041         allowContentParam = ! builder.disableContentParam;
5042         allowedHeaderParams = newCaseInsensitiveSet(opt(builder.allowedHeaderParams).map(x -> "NONE".equals(x) ? "" : x).orElse(""));
5043         allowedMethodHeaders = newCaseInsensitiveSet(opt(builder.allowedMethodHeaders).map(x -> "NONE".equals(x) ? "" : x).orElse(""));
5044         allowedMethodParams = newCaseInsensitiveSet(opt(builder.allowedMethodParams).map(x -> "NONE".equals(x) ? "" : x).orElse(""));
5045         clientVersionHeader = builder.clientVersionHeader;
5046         defaultCharset = builder.defaultCharset;
5047         maxInput = builder.maxInput;
5048         renderResponseStackTraces = builder.renderResponseStackTraces;
5049         uriAuthority = builder.uriAuthority;
5050         uriContext = builder.uriContext;
5051         uriRelativity = builder.uriRelativity;
5052         uriResolution = builder.uriResolution;
5053
5054         beanContext = bs.add(BeanContext.class, builder.beanContext().build());
5055         encoders = bs.add(EncoderSet.class, builder.encoders().build());
5056         serializers = bs.add(SerializerSet.class, builder.serializers().build());
5057         parsers = bs.add(ParserSet.class, builder.parsers().build());
5058         logger = bs.add(Logger.class, builder.logger());
5059         thrownStore = bs.add(ThrownStore.class, builder.thrownStore().build());
5060         methodExecStore = bs.add(MethodExecStore.class, builder.methodExecStore().thrownStoreOnce(thrownStore).build());
5061         messages = bs.add(Messages.class, builder.messages().build());
5062         varResolver = bs.add(VarResolver.class, builder.varResolver().bean(Messages.class, messages).build());
5063         config = bs.add(Config.class, builder.config().resolving(varResolver.createSession()));
5064         responseProcessors = bs.add(ResponseProcessor[].class, builder.responseProcessors().build().toArray());
5065         callLogger = bs.add(CallLogger.class, builder.callLogger().orElse(null));
5066         partSerializer = bs.add(HttpPartSerializer.class, builder.partSerializer().create());
5067         partParser = bs.add(HttpPartParser.class, builder.partParser().create());
5068         jsonSchemaGenerator = bs.add(JsonSchemaGenerator.class, builder.jsonSchemaGenerator().build());
5069         staticFiles = bs.add(StaticFiles.class, builder.staticFiles().orElse(null));
5070         bs.add(FileFinder.class, staticFiles);
5071         defaultRequestHeaders = bs.add(HeaderList.class, builder.defaultRequestHeaders(), "defaultRequestHeaders");
5072         defaultResponseHeaders = bs.add(HeaderList.class, builder.defaultResponseHeaders(), "defaultResponseHeaders");
5073         defaultRequestAttributes = bs.add(NamedAttributeMap.class, builder.defaultRequestAttributes(), "defaultRequestAttributes");
5074         restOpArgs = builder.restOpArgs().build().asArray();
5075         debugEnablement = bs.add(DebugEnablement.class, builder.debugEnablement().orElse(null));
5076         startCallMethods = builder.startCallMethods().stream().map(this::toMethodInvoker).toArray(MethodInvoker[]::new);
5077         endCallMethods = builder.endCallMethods().stream().map(this::toMethodInvoker).toArray(MethodInvoker[]::new);
5078         postInitMethods = builder.postInitMethods().stream().map(this::toMethodInvoker).toArray(MethodInvoker[]::new);
5079         postInitChildFirstMethods = builder.postInitChildFirstMethods().stream().map(this::toMethodInvoker).toArray(MethodInvoker[]::new);
5080         destroyMethods = builder.destroyMethods().stream().map(this::toMethodInvoker).toArray(MethodInvoker[]::new);
5081         preCallMethods = builder.preCallMethods();
5082         postCallMethods = builder.postCallMethods();
5083         restOperations = builder.restOperations(this).build();
5084         restChildren = builder.restChildren(this).build();
5085         swaggerProvider = bs.add(SwaggerProvider.class, builder.swaggerProvider().orElse(null));
5086
5087         var opContexts = restOperations.getOpContexts();
5088
5089         // @formatter:off
5090         produces = builder.produces().orElseGet(
5091            ()->{
5092               Set<MediaType> s = opContexts.isEmpty() ? emptySet() : toSet(opContexts.get(0).getSerializers().getSupportedMediaTypes());
5093               opContexts.forEach(x -> s.retainAll(x.getSerializers().getSupportedMediaTypes()));
5094               return u(toList(s));
5095            }
5096         );
5097         consumes = builder.consumes().orElseGet(
5098            ()->{
5099               Set<MediaType> s = opContexts.isEmpty() ? emptySet() : toSet(opContexts.get(0).getParsers().getSupportedMediaTypes());
5100               opContexts.forEach(x -> s.retainAll(x.getParsers().getSupportedMediaTypes()));
5101               return u(toList(s));
5102            }
5103         );
5104         // @formatter:on
5105
5106      } catch (BasicHttpException e) {
5107         _initException = e;
5108         throw e;
5109      } catch (Exception e) {
5110         _initException = new InternalServerError(e);
5111         throw e;
5112      } finally {
5113         initException = _initException;
5114      }
5115   }
5116
5117   @Override /* Overridden from Context */
5118   public RestSession.Builder createSession() {
5119      return RestSession.create(this);
5120   }
5121
5122   /**
5123    * Called during servlet destruction to invoke all {@link RestDestroy} methods.
5124    */
5125   public void destroy() {
5126      for (var x : destroyMethods) {
5127         try {
5128            x.invoke(beanStore, getResource());
5129         } catch (Exception e) {
5130            getLogger().log(Level.WARNING, unwrap(e), () -> f("Error occurred invoking servlet-destroy method ''{0}''.", x.getFullName()));
5131         }
5132      }
5133
5134      restChildren.destroy();
5135   }
5136
5137   /**
5138    * The main service method.
5139    *
5140    * <p>
5141    * Subclasses can optionally override this method if they want to tailor the behavior of requests.
5142    *
5143    * @param resource
5144    *    The REST servlet or bean that this context defines.
5145    *    <br>Note that this bean may not be the same bean used during initialization as it may have been replaced at runtime.
5146    * @param r1 The incoming HTTP servlet request object.
5147    * @param r2 The incoming HTTP servlet response object.
5148    * @throws ServletException General servlet exception.
5149    * @throws IOException Thrown by underlying stream.
5150    */
5151   public void execute(Object resource, HttpServletRequest r1, HttpServletResponse r2) throws ServletException, IOException {
5152
5153      // Must be careful not to bleed thread-locals.
5154      if (nn(localSession.get()))
5155         System.err.println("WARNING:  Thread-local call object was not cleaned up from previous request.  " + this + ", thread=[" + Thread.currentThread().getId() + "]");
5156
5157      RestSession.Builder sb = createSession().resource(resource).req(r1).res(r2).logger(getCallLogger());
5158
5159      try {
5160
5161         if (nn(initException))
5162            throw initException;
5163
5164         // If the resource path contains variables (e.g. @Rest(path="/f/{a}/{b}"), then we want to resolve
5165         // those variables and push the servletPath to include the resolved variables.  The new pathInfo will be
5166         // the remainder after the new servletPath.
5167         // Only do this for the top-level resource because the logic for child resources are processed next.
5168         if (pathMatcher.hasVars() && parentContext == null) {
5169            var sp = sb.req().getServletPath();
5170            var pi = sb.getPathInfoUndecoded();
5171            var upi2 = UrlPath.of(pi == null ? sp : sp + pi);
5172            var uppm = pathMatcher.match(upi2);
5173            if (nn(uppm) && ! uppm.hasEmptyVars()) {
5174               sb.pathVars(uppm.getVars());
5175               sb.req(new OverrideableHttpServletRequest(sb.req()).pathInfo(nullIfEmpty(urlDecode(uppm.getSuffix()))).servletPath(uppm.getPrefix()));
5176            } else {
5177               var call = sb.build();
5178               call.debug(isDebug(call)).status(SC_NOT_FOUND).finish();
5179               return;
5180            }
5181         }
5182
5183         // If this resource has child resources, try to recursively call them.
5184         var childMatch = restChildren.findMatch(sb);
5185         if (childMatch.isPresent()) {
5186            var uppm = childMatch.get().getPathMatch();
5187            var rc = childMatch.get().getChildContext();
5188            if (! uppm.hasEmptyVars()) {
5189               sb.pathVars(uppm.getVars());
5190               var childRequest = new OverrideableHttpServletRequest(sb.req()).pathInfo(nullIfEmpty(urlDecode(uppm.getSuffix())))
5191                  .servletPath(sb.req().getServletPath() + uppm.getPrefix());
5192               rc.execute(rc.getResource(), childRequest, sb.res());
5193            } else {
5194               var call = sb.build();
5195               call.debug(isDebug(call)).status(SC_NOT_FOUND).finish();
5196            }
5197            return;
5198         }
5199
5200      } catch (Throwable e) {
5201         handleError(sb.build(), convertThrowable(e));
5202      }
5203
5204      var s = sb.build();
5205
5206      try {
5207         localSession.set(s);
5208         s.debug(isDebug(s));
5209         startCall(s);
5210         s.run();
5211      } catch (Throwable e) {
5212         handleError(s, convertThrowable(e));
5213      } finally {
5214         try {
5215            s.finish();
5216            endCall(s);
5217         } finally {
5218            localSession.remove();
5219         }
5220      }
5221   }

5611   /**
5612    * Returns the swagger for the REST resource.
5613    *
5614    * @param locale The locale of the swagger to return.
5615    * @return The swagger as an {@link Optional}.  Never <jk>null</jk>.
5616    */
5617   public Optional<Swagger> getSwagger(Locale locale) {
5618      Swagger s = swaggerCache.get(locale);
5619      if (s == null) {
5620         try {
5621            s = swaggerProvider.getSwagger(this, locale);
5622            if (nn(s))
5623               swaggerCache.put(locale, s);
5624         } catch (Exception e) {
5625            throw new InternalServerError(e);
5626         }
5627      }
5628      return opt(s);
5629   }

5645   /**

5718   /**
5719    * Returns the variable resolver for this servlet.
5720    *
5721    * <p>
5722    * Variable resolvers are used to replace variables in property values.
5723    * They can be nested arbitrarily deep.
5724    * They can also return values that themselves contain other variables.
5725    *
5726    * <h5 class='figure'>Example:</h5>
5727    * <p class='bjava'>
5728    *    <ja>@Rest</ja>(
5729    *       messages=<js>"nls/Messages"</js>,
5730    *       properties={
5731    *          <ja>@Property</ja>(name=<js>"title"</js>,value=<js>"$L{title}"</js>),  <jc>// Localized variable in Messages.properties</jc>
5732    *          <ja>@Property</ja>(name=<js>"javaVendor"</js>,value=<js>"$S{java.vendor,Oracle}"</js>),  <jc>// System property with default value</jc>
5733    *          <ja>@Property</ja>(name=<js>"foo"</js>,value=<js>"bar"</js>),
5734    *          <ja>@Property</ja>(name=<js>"bar"</js>,value=<js>"baz"</js>),
5735    *          <ja>@Property</ja>(name=<js>"v1"</js>,value=<js>"$R{foo}"</js>),  <jc>// Request variable.  value="bar"</jc>
5736    *          <ja>@Property</ja>(name=<js>"v1"</js>,value=<js>"$R{foo,bar}"</js>),  <jc>// Request variable.  value="bar"</jc>
5737    *       }
5738    *    )
5739    *    <jk>public class</jk> MyRestResource <jk>extends</jk> BasicRestServlet {
5740    * </p>
5741    *
5742    * <p>
5743    * A typical usage pattern involves using variables inside the {@link HtmlDocConfig @HtmlDocConfig} annotation:
5744    * <p class='bjava'>
5745    *    <ja>@RestGet</ja>(<js>"/{name}/*"</js>)
5746    *    <ja>@HtmlDocConfig</ja>(
5747    *       navlinks={
5748    *          <js>"up: $R{requestParentURI}"</js>,
5749    *          <js>"api: servlet:/api"</js>,
5750    *          <js>"stats: servlet:/stats"</js>,
5751    *          <js>"editLevel: servlet:/editLevel?logger=$A{attribute.name, OFF}"</js>
5752    *       }
5753    *       header={
5754    *          <js>"&lt;h1&gt;$L{MyLocalizedPageTitle}&lt;/h1&gt;"</js>
5755    *       },
5756    *       aside={
5757    *          <js>"$F{resources/AsideText.html}"</js>
5758    *       }
5759    *    )
5760    *    <jk>public</jk> LoggerEntry getLogger(RestRequest <jv>req</jv>, <ja>@Path</ja> String <jv>name</jv>) <jk>throws</jk> Exception {
5761    * </p>
5762    *
5763    * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
5764    *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/RestServerSvlVariables">SVL Variables</a>
5765    * </ul>
5766    *
5767    * @return The var resolver in use by this resource.
5768    */
5769   public VarResolver getVarResolver() { return varResolver; }
5770

5776    * </ul>
5777    *

5779    */
5780   public boolean isAllowContentParam() { return allowContentParam; }

5789   /**
5790    * Called during servlet initialization to invoke all {@link RestPostInit} child-last methods.
5791    *
5792    * @return This object.
5793    * @throws ServletException Error occurred.
5794    */
5795   public synchronized RestContext postInit() throws ServletException {
5796      if (initialized.get())
5797         return this;
5798      var resource = getResource();
5799      var mi = ClassInfo.of(getResource()).getPublicMethod(x -> x.hasName("setContext") && x.hasParameterTypes(RestContext.class)).orElse(null);
5800      if (nn(mi)) {
5801         try {
5802            mi.accessible().invoke(resource, this);
5803         } catch (ExecutableException e) {
5804            throw new ServletException(e.unwrap());
5805         }
5806      }
5807      for (var x : postInitMethods) {
5808         try {
5809            x.invoke(beanStore, getResource());
5810         } catch (Exception e) {
5811            throw new ServletException(unwrap(e));
5812         }
5813      }
5814      restChildren.postInit();
5815      return this;
5816   }
5817
5818   /**
5819    * Called during servlet initialization to invoke all {@link RestPostInit} child-first methods.
5820    *
5821    * @return This object.
5822    * @throws ServletException Error occurred.
5823    */
5824   public RestContext postInitChildFirst() throws ServletException {
5825      if (initialized.get())
5826         return this;
5827      restChildren.postInitChildFirst();
5828      for (var x : postInitChildFirstMethods) {
5829         try {
5830            x.invoke(beanStore, getResource());
5831         } catch (Exception e) {
5832            throw new ServletException(unwrap(e));
5833         }
5834      }
5835      initialized.set(true);
5836      return this;
5837   }
5838
5839   private boolean isDebug(RestSession call) {
5840      return debugEnablement.isDebug(this, call.getRequest());
5841   }
5842
5843   private static Set<String> newCaseInsensitiveSet(String value) {
5844      var s = new TreeSet<>(String.CASE_INSENSITIVE_ORDER) {
5845         private static final long serialVersionUID = 1L;
5846
5847         @Override
5848         public boolean contains(Object v) {
5849            return v == null ? false : super.contains(v);
5850         }
5851      };
5852      StringUtils.split(value, x -> s.add(x));
5853      return u(s);
5854   }

5856   private MethodInvoker toMethodInvoker(Method m) {
5857      return new MethodInvoker(m, getMethodExecStats(m));
5858   }
5859
5860   private static Throwable unwrap(Throwable t) {
5861      if (t instanceof InvocationTargetException t2)
5862         return t2.getTargetException();
5863      return t;
5864   }
5865
5866   /**
5867    * Method that can be subclassed to allow uncaught throwables to be treated as other types of throwables.
5868    *
5869    * <p>
5870    * The default implementation looks at the throwable class name to determine whether it can be converted to another type:
5871    *
5872    * <ul>
5873    *    <li><js>"*AccessDenied*"</js> - Converted to {@link Unauthorized}.
5874    *    <li><js>"*Empty*"</js>,<js>"*NotFound*"</js> - Converted to {@link NotFound}.
5875    * </ul>
5876    *
5877    * @param t The thrown object.
5878    * @return The converted thrown object.
5879    */
5880   protected Throwable convertThrowable(Throwable t) {
5881
5882      if (t instanceof InvocationTargetException t2)
5883         t = t2.getTargetException();
5884
5885      if (t instanceof ExecutableException t3)
5886         t = t3.getTargetException();
5887
5888      if (t instanceof BasicHttpException t2)
5889         return t2;
5890
5891      var ci = ClassInfo.of(t);
5892
5893      if (ci.hasAnnotation(Response.class))
5894         return t;
5895
5896      if (ci.isChildOf(ParseException.class) || ci.is(InvalidDataConversionException.class))
5897         return new BadRequest(t);
5898
5899      String n = cn(t);
5900
5901      if (co(n, "AccessDenied") || co(n, "Unauthorized"))
5902         return new Unauthorized(t);
5903
5904      if (co(n, "Empty") || co(n, "NotFound"))
5905         return new NotFound(t);
5906
5907      return t;
5908   }
5909
5910   /**
5911    * Called at the end of a request to invoke all {@link RestEndCall} methods.
5912    *
5913    * <p>
5914    * This is the very last method called in {@link #execute(Object, HttpServletRequest, HttpServletResponse)}.
5915    *
5916    * @param session The current request.
5917    */
5918   protected void endCall(RestSession session) {
5919      for (var x : endCallMethods) {
5920         try {
5921            x.invoke(session.getBeanStore(), session.getResource());
5922         } catch (Exception e) {
5923            getLogger().log(Level.WARNING, unwrap(e), () -> f("Error occurred invoking finish-call method ''{0}''.", x.getFullName()));
5924         }
5925      }
5926   }
5927
5928   /**
5929    * Finds the {@link RestOpArg} instances to handle resolving objects on the calls to the specified Java method.
5930    *
5931    * @param m The Java method being called.
5932    * @param beanStore
5933    *    The factory used for creating beans and retrieving injected beans.
5934    *    <br>Created by {@link RestContext.Builder#beanStore()}.
5935    * @return The array of resolvers.
5936    */
5937   protected RestOpArg[] findRestOperationArgs(Method m, BeanStore beanStore) {
5938
5939      var mi = MethodInfo.of(m);
5940      var params = mi.getParameters();
5941      var ra = new RestOpArg[params.size()];
5942
5943      beanStore = BeanStore.of(beanStore, getResource());
5944
5945      for (var i = 0; i < params.size(); i++) {
5946         var pi = params.get(i);
5947         beanStore.addBean(ParameterInfo.class, pi);
5948         for (var c : restOpArgs) {
5949            try {
5950               ra[i] = beanStore.createBean(RestOpArg.class).type(c).run();
5951               if (nn(ra[i]))
5952                  break;
5953            } catch (ExecutableException e) {
5954               throw new InternalServerError(e.unwrap(), "Could not resolve parameter {0} on method {1}.", i, mi.getFullName());
5955            }
5956         }
5957         if (ra[i] == null)
5958            throw new InternalServerError("Could not resolve parameter {0} on method {1}.", i, mi.getFullName());
5959      }
5960
5961      return ra;
5962   }

5970   protected MethodExecStats getMethodExecStats(Method m) {
5971      return this.methodExecStore.getStats(m);
5972   }

5988   /**
5989    * Method for handling response errors.
5990    *
5991    * <p>
5992    * Subclasses can override this method to provide their own custom error response handling.
5993    *
5994    * @param session The rest call.
5995    * @param e The exception that occurred.
5996    * @throws IOException Can be thrown if a problem occurred trying to write to the output stream.
5997    */
5998   protected synchronized void handleError(RestSession session, Throwable e) throws IOException {
5999
6000      session.exception(e);
6001
6002      if (session.isDebug())
6003         e.printStackTrace();
6004
6005      int code = 500;
6006
6007      var ci = ClassInfo.of(e);
6008      var r = ci.getAnnotations(StatusCode.class).findFirst().map(AnnotationInfo::inner).orElse(null);
6009      if (nn(r))
6010         if (r.value().length > 0)
6011            code = r.value()[0];
6012
6013      var e2 = (e instanceof BasicHttpException e3 ? e3 : new BasicHttpException(code, e));
6014
6015      var req = session.getRequest();
6016      var res = session.getResponse();
6017
6018      Throwable t = e2.getRootCause();
6019      if (nn(t)) {
6020         Thrown t2 = thrown(t);
6021         res.setHeader(t2.getName(), t2.getValue());
6022      }
6023
6024      try {
6025         res.setContentType("text/plain");
6026         res.setHeader("Content-Encoding", "identity");
6027         var statusCode = e2.getStatusLine().getStatusCode();
6028         res.setStatus(statusCode);
6029
6030         var w = (PrintWriter)null;
6031         try {
6032            w = res.getWriter();
6033         } catch (@SuppressWarnings("unused") IllegalStateException x) {
6034            w = new PrintWriter(new OutputStreamWriter(res.getOutputStream(), UTF8));
6035         }
6036
6037         try (PrintWriter w2 = w) {
6038            var httpMessage = RestUtils.getHttpResponseText(statusCode);
6039            if (nn(httpMessage))
6040               w2.append("HTTP ").append(String.valueOf(statusCode)).append(": ").append(httpMessage).append("\n\n");
6041            if (isRenderResponseStackTraces())
6042               e.printStackTrace(w2);
6043            else
6044               w2.append(e2.getFullStackMessage(true));
6045         }
6046
6047      } catch (Exception e1) {
6048         req.setAttribute("Exception", e1);
6049      }
6050   }
6051
6052   /**
6053    * Handle the case where a matching method was not found.
6054    *
6055    * <p>
6056    * Subclasses can override this method to provide a 2nd-chance for specifying a response.
6057    * The default implementation will simply throw an exception with an appropriate message.
6058    *
6059    * @param session The HTTP call.
6060    * @throws Exception Any exception can be thrown.
6061    */
6062   protected void handleNotFound(RestSession session) throws Exception {
6063      var pathInfo = session.getPathInfo();
6064      var methodUC = session.getMethod();
6065      var rc = session.getStatus();
6066      var onPath = pathInfo == null ? " on no pathInfo" : String.format(" on path '%s'", pathInfo);
6067      if (rc == SC_NOT_FOUND)
6068         throw new NotFound("Method ''{0}'' not found on resource with matching pattern{1}.", methodUC, onPath);
6069      else if (rc == SC_PRECONDITION_FAILED)
6070         throw new PreconditionFailed("Method ''{0}'' not found on resource{1} with matching matcher.", methodUC, onPath);
6071      else if (rc == SC_METHOD_NOT_ALLOWED)
6072         throw new MethodNotAllowed("Method ''{0}'' not found on resource{1}.", methodUC, onPath);
6073      else
6074         throw new ServletException("Invalid method response: " + rc, session.getException());
6075   }

6077   /**
6078       * Called during a request to invoke all {@link RestPostCall} methods.
6079       *
6080       * @param session The current request.
6081       * @throws Throwable If thrown from call methods.
6082       */
6083   protected void postCall(RestOpSession session) throws Throwable {
6084      for (var m : session.getContext().getPostCallMethods())
6085         m.invoke(session);
6086   }

6090    *
6091    * @param session The current request.
6092    * @throws Throwable If thrown from call methods.
6093    */
6094   protected void preCall(RestOpSession session) throws Throwable {
6095      for (var m : session.getContext().getPreCallMethods())
6096         m.invoke(session);
6097   }

6099   /**
6100    * The main method for serializing POJOs passed in through the {@link RestResponse#setContent(Object)} method or
6101    * returned by the Java method.
6102    *
6103    * <p>
6104    * Subclasses may override this method if they wish to modify the way the output is rendered or support other output
6105    * formats.
6106    *
6107    * <p>
6108    * The default implementation simply iterates through the response handlers on this resource
6109    * looking for the first one whose {@link ResponseProcessor#process(RestOpSession)} method returns
6110    * <jk>true</jk>.
6111    *
6112    * @param opSession The HTTP call.
6113    * @throws IOException Thrown by underlying stream.
6114    * @throws BasicHttpException Non-200 response.
6115    * @throws NotImplemented No registered response processors could handle the call.
6116    */
6117   protected void processResponse(RestOpSession opSession) throws IOException, BasicHttpException, NotImplemented {
6118
6119      // Loop until we find the correct processor for the POJO.
6120      int loops = 5;
6121      for (var i = 0; i < responseProcessors.length; i++) {
6122         var j = responseProcessors[i].process(opSession);
6123         if (j == FINISHED)
6124            return;
6125         if (j == RESTART) {
6126            if (loops-- < 0)
6127               throw new InternalServerError("Too many processing loops.");
6128            i = -1;  // Start over.
6129         }
6130      }
6131
6132      var output = opSession.getResponse().getContent().orElse(null);
6133      throw new NotImplemented("No response processors found to process output of type ''{0}''", cn(output));
6134   }
6135
6136   @Override /* Overridden from Context */
6137   protected FluentMap<String,Object> properties() {
6138      return super.properties()
6139         .a("allowContentParam", allowContentParam)
6140         .a("allowedHeaderParams", allowedHeaderParams)
6141         .a("allowedMethodHeader", allowedMethodHeaders)
6142         .a("allowedMethodParams", allowedMethodParams)
6143         .a("beanStore", beanStore)
6144         .a("clientVersionHeader", clientVersionHeader)
6145         .a("consumes", consumes)
6146         .a("defaultRequestHeaders", defaultRequestHeaders)
6147         .a("defaultResponseHeaders", defaultResponseHeaders)
6148         .a("partParser", partParser)
6149         .a("partSerializer", partSerializer)
6150         .a("produces", produces)
6151         .a("renderResponseStackTraces", renderResponseStackTraces)
6152         .a("responseProcessors", responseProcessors)
6153         .a("restOpArgs", restOpArgs)
6154         .a("staticFiles", staticFiles)
6155         .a("swaggerProvider", swaggerProvider)
6156         .a("uriAuthority", uriAuthority)
6157         .a("uriContext", uriContext)
6158         .a("uriRelativity", uriRelativity)
6159         .a("uriResolution", uriResolution);
6160   }
6161
6162   /**
6163    * Called at the start of a request to invoke all {@link RestStartCall} methods.
6164    *
6165    * @param session The current request.
6166    * @throws BasicHttpException If thrown from call methods.
6167    */
6168   protected void startCall(RestSession session) throws BasicHttpException {
6169      for (var x : startCallMethods) {
6170         try {
6171            x.invoke(session.getBeanStore(), session.getContext().getResource());
6172         } catch (IllegalAccessException | IllegalArgumentException e) {
6173            throw new InternalServerError(e, "Error occurred invoking start-call method ''{0}''.", x.getFullName());
6174         } catch (InvocationTargetException e) {
6175            var t = e.getTargetException();
6176            if (t instanceof BasicHttpException t2)
6177               throw t2;
6178            throw new InternalServerError(t);
6179         }
6180      }
6181   }
6182}
